column1: IS_IN_REGION; is in the region ;Est dans la région;Ist in der Region ;;Está en la región;;;;;;;;;x
supports_imperial_edict;Supports the Imperial edict against foreigners;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: this is the policy under which no foreigner could enter Japan under pain of death. Maintained by the Tokugawa shogunate
column3: it has kept the nation in enforced isolation since the 17th century.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: this refers to the body of knowledge developed by Japan through its contacts with the Dutch enclave of Dejima
column3: which allowed Japan to keep abreast of Western technology and medicine in the period when the country was closed to foreigners.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: kobu_gattai_desc;This was a policy of the Tokugawa shogunate aiming at increasing political coordination between the bakufu and the Imperial Court
column2: as well as appeasing opponents within the shogunate itself.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC185;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Temperance League has been increasingly active in one of our states this year
column2: with a campaign to harass local public houses and liquor merchants. Many of their more politically-minded members have even approached members of the government in $CAPITAL$
column3: pushing for greater support for their campaign.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC186;The libertine culture in $COUNTRY$ has drawn criticism
column2: with news of a scandal that reaches to the very heights of government. Several ministers are accused of unsavory dealings
column3: and there are calls in $CAPITAL$ for the government to support religious groups in their calls for moderation and temperance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2600;$COUNTRY$ has maintained control over $STATENAME$ for us to consider the possibility of integrating it into $COUNTRY$ as a whole. There are $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags waving in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: flown by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column3: so it does not seem so far-fetched an idea that $STATENAME$ be eventually considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory by the world at large.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2605;$COUNTRY$ has controlled $PROVINCENAME$ for a long time-- long enough for those within $PROVINCENAME$ to truly consider themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column2: and for the rest of the world to consider the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claim to the province to be legitimate as well. Though there are still some unhappy with the development
column3: $PROVINCENAME$ is now considered an integral part of $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2610;$STATENAME$ is considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory-- that is only in dispute by those neighbours who still have recognized claims on the area
column2: and who maintain that many within $STATENAME$ consider themselves citizens of their country and not ours. The first step in rendering their claim invalid would be to enact a policy that encourages the assimilation of all people within $STATENAME$... they should be $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column3: and hold no other nationality above ours.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2611;With the new government in power and its more liberal views on minorities within $COUNTRY$
column2: the policies of assimilation that attempted to stamp out minorities of other nationalities have all been rescinded. There are those within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military who warn that this is a dangerous idea
column3: and that allowing these foreign identities to perpetuate will only lead to further conflict with our neighbours-- but
column4: for now
column5: their voices have been ignored.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2615;A demonstration in $PROVINCENAME$ turned violent as minorities held up $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags and burned them-- a demonstration of their rejection of our attempts to assimilate them into $COUNTRY$. Authorities broke up the demonstration
column2: but there continues to be a growing discontent in the area. The turmoil has even spread to other citizens
column3: who have begun calling on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to end its assimilation policies and let the minority groups be.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2616;The recent arrest of a foreign national in $PROVINCENAME$ has led to a diplomatic incident. Many of the minorities within $PROVINCENAME$ claim that the man was arrested solely because he opposed the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ assimilation policies
column2: and was trying to spread word of a peaceful resistance. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities say the man's interest was not peaceful in the least
column3: and they suspect he in fact works for one of our neighbours with a claim on $PROVINCENAME$. Whatever the truth
column4: the reaction has not been peaceful in the least-- riots are expected
column5: and authorities say to be wary of rebellion in the area.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2620;A parade has recently taken place in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flag flying high-- and being held by people who
column3: until very recently
column4: likely wouldn't have considered themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens at all. $PROVINCENAME$ is still claimed by another country
column5: but the acceptance of $PROVINCENAME$'s people is going a long way towards making elimination of that an inevitable fact.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2625;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flag is the only one that can now be found flying in the streets of $PROVINCENAME$. At long last
column2: it can be considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ and only $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory. Even those who are members of other cultures no longer consider themselves truly part of our neighbours-- much as those neighbours might be unhappy with the situation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2626;$FROMCOUNTRY$ continues to hold some of our lands
column2: lands which until today have always been considered part of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ national territory. A $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ program of assimilation has succeeded
column3: however
column4: in weaning our own people away from any feeling as if this true. They no longer consider themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column5: and indeed the international community appears to agree with them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2650;According to our peace treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: we must give up lands that rightfully belong to them-- and only the ones that belong to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2651;According to our peace treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: we must give up lands that rightfully belong to another nation-- but only those lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2660;As a result of the treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: some of $COUNTRY$'s lands are to be returned. We are
column3: however
column4: only entitled to those lands over which we have a claim. Any others should
column5: by all rights
column6: be returned to $FROMCOUNTRY$.\n\n§RNOTE: If you took $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ core provinces which are not also your own core provinces in this war
column7: enacting the 'return' option will give those lands back. Be careful!§W;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the dreaded potato blight
column3: has struck one of our farming provinces. Starving smallholders
column4: and in some places driving whole families from their homes
column5: the potato blight has caused a localized famine that threatens to spread.;;Phytophthora infestans
column6: die gefürchtete Kartoffelfäule
column7: ist in $PROVINCENAME$ ausgebrochen. Die Krankheit bringt lokale Kleinbauern ans Hungertuch
column8: treibt an manchen Orten ganze Familien aus ihren Heimen
column9: und hat generell vor Ort eine Hungersnot ausgelöst
column10: die sich auszubreiten droht. Im Parlament wie auch vor Ort treten die Liberalen vor
column14: dass vielleicht nicht die Knollenfäule selbst

column1: EVTDESC10120_NEW;A new daily has begun circulating in $COUNTRY$. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Herald
column2: carrying hard-hitting political commentary
column3: literary critique and local news
column4: has quickly developed into a flagship for local liberal politics.;;Eine neue Tageszeitung ist in $COUNTRY$ erschienen. Mit beißenden politischen Kommentaren
column5: Literaturkritik und Lokalnachrichten ist der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Herald schnell zu einem Flaggschiff für liberale Lokalpolitik geworden.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC10130_NEW;A local chapter of the Chartist Society
column2: calling for a broadening of the voting franchise
column3: and an end to landed voting rights
column4: has opened in $COUNTRY$.;Une branche locale de la Société chartiste
column5: appelant à un élargissement du droit de vote et à la fin du système électoral censitaire est apparue en $COUNTRY$.;Ein lokaler Zweig der Chartistengesellschaft ist in $COUNTRY$ aktiv geworden und ruft nach größeren Wahlrechten und einem Ende der landbesitzgebundenen Wahlrechts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC10140_NEW;Liberal causes have started to gain traction in $COUNTRY$. While no one knows for sure
column2: rumor has it that the root cause of this sudden upswing in liberal propaganda efforts is the recent foundation of a secret society
column3: forced into hiding due to the persecution of any legitimate opposition to the ruling party. Whether it be the Rosecrucians or the Illuminati
column4: these society members will continue to act from the shadows until $COUNTRY$ allows free debate and opposition in its politics.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10150_NEW;The smog from the factories hangs low against the blood red of a charcoal sky. Far away in the depths of the city
column2: in the deepest bowels of the industrial machine
column3: the cries and shouts of a forming mob can be heard echoing against a backdrop of drainpipes and smokestacks. Infuriated over poor working conditions
column4: clamoring for a return to a lost pastoral dream remembered
column5: Luddites take to the streets in $COUNTRY$.;;Der kohlschwarze Qualm der Fabriken hängt tief gegen den blutroten Himmel. Tief im Herzen der Stadt
column6: in den untersten Kellern der Industriemaschine
column7: kann man die Schreie und Rufes des sich bildenden Mobs im Echo gegen den Hintergrund von Kühlröhren und Schornsteinen hören. Erzürnt über schlechte Arbeitsbedingungen ziehen die Ludditen auf die Straße in $COUNTRY$ und verlangen die Wiederkehr eines ländlichen Traums.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: flowing through every concievable crack in the dams of legal authority. Liberals in $COUNTRY$ have
column3: on account of the ban on public meetings
column4: begun holding banquets. Ostentsibly without purpose -- A gathering among friends
column5: a celebration
column6: a feast -- the common knowledge secret that no one dare pronounce is that these banquets are political meetings carried out behind a thin veneer of legality.;;Sittenlosigkeit ist wie Wasser - sie fließt durch jeden Riss in den Dämmen der Gesetzesautorität. Die Liberalen in $COUNTRY$ haben wegen des Verbots öffentlicher Versammlungen begonnen
column7: Bankette abzuhalten. Nach außen völlig absichtslos -- ein Treffen von Freunden
column8: eine Feier
column9: ein Fest -- doch ist jedem klar
column10: was er nicht auszusprechen wagt: dass diese Bankette politische Treffen sind
column11: die sich hinter einem sehr dünnen Anstrich der Legalität verstrecken.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: the preachers of modernity move effortlessly back and forth across our borders. Liberal agitation has spread to $PROVINCENAME$ from a neighboring province and is now threatening to enflame the entire state. We might want to send some troops here.;Comme des rats porteurs de maladies contagieuses
column3: les prédicateurs modernes vont et viennent facilement de part et d'autres de nos frontières. L'agitation libérale s'étend à $PROVINCENAME$ depuis une province voisine.;Wie Ratten mit ansteckenden Krankheiten bewegen sich die Prediger der Modernität mühelos über unsere Grenzen hinweg. Liberale Agitation ist aus einer Nachbarprovinz nach $PROVINCENAME$ übergeschwappt.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: a hoarse voice cries. The streets in $PROVINCENAME$ have come alive. A local injustice
column3: or the perception of one
column4: have animated the unwashed masses into rebellion against our rule and threatens to spread to the rest of the state. The revolt is still small enough that its future course has not been set in stone
column5: and leniency might avert it
column6: but perhaps it is best to put our foot down firmly to set an example?;;Tod dem König!'
column7: schreit eine heisere Stimme. Die Straßen in $PROVINCENAME$ sind zum Leben erwacht. Eine lokale Ungerechtigkeit bzw. das
column8: was manche dafür ansehen
column9: hat eine Rebellion der ungewaschenen Horden gegen unsere Herrschaft entfacht. Die Revolte ist noch klein genug
column10: dass ihr künftiger Kurs noch nicht in Stein gemeißelt steht. Mit Milde könnte man noch etwas erreichen
column11: aber vieleicht ist es am besten

column1: EVTDESC10205;Tensions in one of our provinces reached a boiling point recently
column2: with liberals and reactionaries battling in the streets. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ police were quick to move in
column3: but tempers remain high and already there are reports of fighting elsewhere in the state. Officials are calling for decisive action to put an end to the violence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: inspired by the wave of liberalism in a neighboring nation
column3: have risen up. Agitators are running through the streets waving flags and calling for their brethren to fight for freedom. Responding with violence could enflame the entire state
column4: but $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials agree that this cannot be allowed to continue.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10155;A fervor has been sweeping through parts of $COUNTRY$
column2: with liberal-minded revolutionaries calling for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens to rise up and demand the unification of $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$. They have begun waving $UNION_ADJ$ flags in the streets
column3: fomenting riots and violence. The police have had difficulties dealing with the problem.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: inspired by the wave of liberalism throughout $COUNTRY$
column3: have risen up. Agitators are running through the streets waving flags and calling for their brethren to fight for freedom. Responding with violence could enflame the entire state
column4: but $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials agree that this cannot be allowed to continue.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10221;A massive demonstration by the Chartists has taken place in Kennington Common
column2: with liberals demanding that the People's Charter be implemented immediately-- giving equal votes to all men
column3: rich or poor
column4: as well as secret ballots and a fair distribution of constituencies. Many in the government are suggesting that such public gatherings should be made illegal
column5: and that at best the British government should make empty promises to these rabble-rousers. Others fear that refusing their demands will lead to the monarchy being toppled by rebellion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10222;Angry crowds have flooded the streets of Paris
column2: shouting cries of 'Down with the King!' and 'Long live the Reform!'. They have erected barricades in the streets and fighting has broken out with the Parisian municipal guards. With the city having been completely closed off from outside help
column3: these crowds have begun to march on the royal palace. Our king has had no choice but to abdicate and flee the country.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10223;Facing the prospect of losing the presidential election
column2: the popular Louis-Napoleon has launched a coup d'etat and overthrown the French government. Loyal members of the army have locked down strategic locations in Paris
column3: and the Assemblée Nationale has been dissolved
column4: leaving Louis-Napoleon as the undisputed ruler of the country. He has been christened Napoléon III
column5: regaining his uncle's throne as the Emperor of France.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10224;Angered by the inability of France to prevent the formation of Germany
column2: as well as the humiliating loss of Alsace-Lorraine
column3: the government has deposed Emperor Napoleon. We must choose what form our new government is to take.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10225;The Hungarian Diet has grown increasingly independent of Austrian rule in recent years. Field Marshall Count Franz Philipp von Lamberg was sent to Hungary to take personal control over their armies
column2: but was attacked upon his arrival. In response
column3: the Austrian government ordered the Hungarian Diet dissolved and the Ban of Croatia installed in Lamberg's place. The Hungarians have refused to obey
column4: and thus we now face civil war to maintain the integrity of the empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10226;We have won our freedom from Austrian rule! The people have gathered in $CAPITAL$ in jubilation!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC10227;Hungarian lands rightfully belong to us. With their new-found freedom
column2: we are left with the decision whether we should pursue our claim to their lands or instead try to reconcile with the Hungarian government. If they remain hostile
column3: after all
column4: and we are unable to defeat them
column5: they will become a very dangerous enemy on our border. Admitting their loss
column6: however
column7: might be a blow to our prestige we will never recover from.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10228;With the entire nation ready to overthrow the monarchy
column2: ministers have approached the King with advice on reforming the constitution before it's too late. The loss of Belgium has made a revision necessary already. Including provisions that permitted the direct election of the lower house as well as numerous freedoms the Dutch do not already enjoy might pacify the liberals.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10229;With the people seemingly ready to break down our doors
column2: demanding constitutional reform
column3: perhaps we should consider giving it to them? Some moderate reforms
column4: allowing the masses their vote but retaining ultimate power for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocracy and the Kaiser
column5: should please them enough to dispel this rabble... for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10400;The unrest in France hit its height recently
column2: with crowds streaming through the streets of Paris and erecting barricades. In what was widely regarded as an accident
column3: a French guardsmen fired his musket on the citizens and set off a massacre. The resulting conflagaration has swept the city
column4: with crowds chanting 'Long live the Reform!' and 'Down with the King!'. Despite assurances that everything is under control
column5: the king has abdicated and fled the country… leaving a provisional government to step in and declare the Second Republic.\n\nNow we have the task of building this new government
column6: starting with a presidential election to determine its new Head of State. Considering the popularity of Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte among the masses
column7: and the granting of universal voting rights
column8: some are concerned that he may in fact take the leadership. If he does
column9: who knows what this may mean for France?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10401;While it was expected that Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte would do well in the French presidential election
column2: no one could have counted on the fact that he has done as well as this. Despite his autocratic leanings and lack of allies in Paris
column3: he has managed to be something to everyone… even gaining the sponsorship of the Orleanists. The provisional government's candidate
column4: Louis-Eugène Cavaignac
column5: led the effort to quell an uprising in the city-- leading to resentment among the masses which has translated into Napoleon's landslide. Many fear the man takes too much after his infamous uncle
column6: and thus the idea has arisen of fixing the elections to ensure Cavaignac's victory. This would require us to restrict universal sufferage
column7: as well as muffle the newspapers and political opponents. Either way
column8: the ideals of the Second Republic seem at risk of compromise.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10402;Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte has swept into power as France's new Head of State. The man carries with him the legacy of his infamous uncle
column2: and with it the support of the masses. He has no friends in Paris
column3: however
column4: almost all of whom are nervous of the possibility that he might decide to follow in his uncle's footsteps.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10405;Unable to force the Upper House to repeal its prohibition against presidential re-election and facing removal from power
column2: the popular Louis-Napoleon has launched a coup d'etat and overthrown the French government. Loyal members of the army have locked down strategic locations in Paris
column3: and the Assemblée Nationale has been dissolved
column4: leaving Louis-Napoleon as the undisputed ruler of the country. He has been christened Napoléon III
column5: regaining his uncle's throne as the Emperor of France.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10410;The popularity of Louis-Napoleon has waned. Where once it was expected that his ascension would return France to the greatness it experienced during the reign of his uncle
column2: instead France sees itself being eclipsed by its neighbours. The Emperor has cultivated many enemies among the liberals in Paris
column3: and now they have chosen their moment to strike. Napoleon has been deposed
column4: and the only question remains as to what form France shall now take. Shall we restore the Bourbon dynasty under the Count of Chambord
column5: elect for a Bourbon constitutional monarchy under the Comte de Paris
column6: or instead opt to create the Third Republic?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10411;Louis-Napoleon has grown ill in recent months
column2: slowly surrendering more and more ground to the Upper House. Thus his death comes with no surprise to many. Mourned by the entire nation
column3: and by his beloved Empress Eugénie
column4: the question now turns to who will follow him. His son and heir would be Napoleon IV… but he is still a young man
column5: eager to live up to the legacy left him. Others favor the popular Bourbon Count of Paris. Still more
column6: however
column7: claim this is the perfect moment to restore the republic and end the monarchy once and for all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11100_NEW;A rising tide of liberal nationalism within $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$ has begun to spread
column2: raising the idea of a $UNION_ADJ$ union with $COUNTRY$ at its head. A parliament of liberal revolutionaries has been convened
column3: with representatives from throughout $UNION_ADJ$ lands
column4: which has decreed the time is right for the nation to unite under one banner. The parliament has offered the crown of $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$ to us. We could accept the offer
column5: but doing so would cause international alarm
column6: and require us to compensate the revolutionaries politically.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11104;A pro-$UNION_ADJ$ revolution has taken hold in $FROMCOUNTRY$. Its liberal leaders believe that $COUNTRY$ is the nation best-suited to unite all of $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$
column2: and thus have sworn to support us until the union is ready to occur.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ambassador has presented us with news from the recent parliament of German revolutionaries. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to assemble a federation of German states
column3: with the goal of eventually forming a greater Germany. If we do not agree
column4: it is possible that $FROMCOUNTRY$ will attempt to take our lands by force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11108;The call has gone out for the Slavic nations of the Balkans to finally unite under a common banner
column2: to resist the encroachment of the Austrians and Turks as well as other European powers. Yugoslavia
column3: it is said
column4: will be a power to rival even its most powerful neighbours. Whether this new nation would succeed in holding together a people divided by centuries of bitter warfare is best left for speculation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11109;The call has gone out for the Ugric nations of Greater Finland to finally unite under a common banner
column2: to resist the encroachment of the Russians as well as other European powers. This new nation
column3: it is said
column4: will be a power to rival even its most powerful neighbours.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11110;An open discussion amongst liberals in $COUNTRY$ has been occurring regarding the formation of a confederation of North German states. Conditions have never been right for it in the past
column2: but many believe such a union is needed if the Germans are ever to have true security and take their place among the powers of the world. A $COUNTRY_ADJ$-led movement to create such a confederation might go over well with our neighbours
column3: if we made the attempt to create it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11115;Many within $COUNTRY$ have always considered it a dream to form a greater union of the Slavic peoples
column2: one spanning all of the Balkans and uniting them under a common flag. Such a nation would be far better suited at resisting the encroachment of foreign powers into the region. Now seems like the perfect opportunity for $COUNTRY$ to form such a union. Do we proceed with the creation of Yugoslavia
column3: or let the dream die here?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11120;The call has come to $COUNTRY$ to unite with Yugoslavia
column2: a union of Slavic countries interested in protecting the Balkans from the encroachment of other European powers. Whether a union of cultures which have before now often been at war
column3: and indeed still have considerable enmity for each other
column4: will be difficult to say.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19006;Our independence is gradually being undercut and more and more becoming something that only exists on paper
column2: as several foreign Great Powers vie for control over our political institutions. Recently
column3: tensions have erupted between several great powers each vying for dominance over our government. If any of them attempts to assert themselves in $COUNTRY$
column4: it will mean conflict with our government
column5: the other great powers
column6: and possibly even war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA13000;We will allow the westerners into $COUNTRY$
column2: so long as they cause no trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB13000;They bring dangerous ideas. $COUNTRY$ will refuse them all access.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC13010;An old pond
A frog jumps in —
The sound of water.'
-- Matsuo Basho
One of our coastal provinces is bustling with rumors about the strange people who were found along its shorelines earlier this morning. The more precise origin of these shipwrecked sailors is as of yet uncertain
column2: but
column3: wherever they are from
column4: they are definitely not from $COUNTRY$. The difficulty now lies in deciding what to do with them: if we send them home
column5: we are effectively changing our policy of non-interaction with the westerners. Ignoring them and allowing them to stay
column6: however
column7: means permitting a western presence in $COUNTRY$ despite all our efforts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA13010;Send them home.;Les laisser rentrer chez eux.;Lasst sie heimkehren.;;Dejadles regresar a casa.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB13010;Allow them to stay.;Les obliger à rester.;Zwingt sie
column2: zu bleiben.;;Obligadles a quedarse.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13015;One of our subjects has been discovered wearing foreign clothes
column2: and further interrogation by the authorities has lead to the slow unraveling of a foreign smuggling ring. These foreigners come into $COUNTRY$ without permission
column3: knowing they face execution should they be caught-- yet some of our advisors say there are benefits to their presence
column4: as they can supply needs to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people that we cannot.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13016;In what should come as no surprise
column2: the foreign smuggling ring in one of our provinces has been caught red-handed selling opium to the locals.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13020;Despite our policy of not permitting foreigners into $COUNTRY$
column2: it has been discovered that a group of foreign missionaries has been traveling among our people and spreading their religion. While we have every right to execute them out of hand
column3: this does raise the possibility of a confrontation with their home country. Do we wish to risk such a war
column4: all for the sake of a few priests?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13021;We have received reports that a number of our missionaries have been executed in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: part of a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ action to round up all unwanted foreigners. The missionaries were peaceful
column3: and the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ public is understandably enraged. Many believe that war is necessary
column4: while others believe the potential for war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ simply isn't worth it. The missionaries knew they were not permitted in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column5: after all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13030;News reaches us that an expatriate community of foreigners
column2: from various European countries and Great Powers
column3: has formed in one of our cities. Doubtlessly
column4: this is a direct effect of our government's policy of open ports and borders. This influx might be positive
column5: as our government seems to believe
column6: however some voices have less kind things to say about the foreigners.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13031;A group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens who left $COUNTRY$ some time ago on an expedition to $FROMCOUNTRY$ has been viciously refused entry to the country. It appears that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has turned gradually to a policy of increasing isolationism
column2: most likely in order to avoid the pains of modernizing their political
column3: economical and social institutions. This policy of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is
column4: obviously
column5: impairing the advances of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ trade
column6: diplomacy and missionary activities in the region
column7: and must be considered an unjust restriction of the international freedom of movement.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13040;Despite the obvious rightness of our country's trade policies
column2: greater amounts of foreign goods could be useful
column3: and elements within our administration have suggested setting up a limited trading post in one of our coastal cities
column4: where foreign ships can moor and trade
column5: without compromising the cultural integrity of $COUNTRY$. It could be an economic boon to the area and the nation
column6: but conservative voices warn that destructive foreign influences might further creep into our society.;;Trotz der offensichtlichen Richtigkeit unserer Isolationspolitik könnte eine gewisse Menge ausländischer Güter uns von Nutzen sein. Einige Elements in unserer Regierung haben vorgeschladen
column7: einen beschränkten Handelsposten in $PROVINCENAME$ zu errichten
column8: wo ausländische Schiffe ankern und handeln können
column9: ohne im Großen und Ganzen unsere Politik der Separation vom Rest der Welt außerhalb $COUNTRYNAME$ zu kompromittieren. Es könnte für das Gebiet wie auch die Nation einen wirtschaftlichen Aufschwung bedeuten
column11: dass destruktive ausländische Einflüsse sich in unsere Gesellschaft einschleichen könnten.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: pungent stench hangs over the backstreets and alleys in one of our cities
column3: emanating and spreading in every direction from an epicenter at the foreign trade station. The European traders have brought with them the habit of opium smoking
column4: and our subjects have taken to it on a scale that threatens to become epidemic. It seems that
column5: for every new ship that lands
column6: more and more of our people get caught in the deadly and pacifying web of addiction. What should we do?;;Ein süßlich-stechender Gestank hängt über den Hintergassen und -gossen in $PROVINCENAME$ und verbreitet sich von einem Epizentrum an der ausländischen Handelsstation in alle Richtungen aus. Die europäischen Händler haben die Gewohnheit des Opiumrauchens mit sich gebracht
column7: und unsere Untertanen haben sie auf eine Stufe erhöht
column8: die zu einer Epidemie zu werden droht. Es scheint
column9: dass mit jedem neuen Schiff
column11: mehr und mehr unserer Untertanen sich im tödlichen Netz der Sucht verstricken. Was sollen wir tun?;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13051;Due to the trade restrictions on the sale of opium
column2: a number of western merchants have instead gone underground. We have word that a group of them have set up shop in one of our coastal provinces
column3: but so far none of the locals seem willing to come forth with information. If we allow the smuggling ring to remain
column4: it seems only a matter of time before the opium problem spreads.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13056;The great clippers ply our coastlines from north to south
column2: like wolves culling out the weak and the corruptible with the poison they sell. Wherever there is an unexposed harbor
column3: a foreign ship soon docks
column4: and drives another fang into our national body. The use of opium has spread throughout $STATENAME$.;Les grands voiliers de commerce sillonent nos côtes du nord au sud
column5: comme des loups à l'abattage des faibles et des corruptibles avec le poison qu'ils vendent. Partout où il y a un port non encore exposé
column6: un navire étranger accoste bientôt
column7: et plante un autre croc dans notre organisme national. L'usage de l'opium s'est étendue à $PROVINCENAME$. ;Die großen Klipper fahren unsere Küste von Norden nach Süden ab
column8: wie Wölfe
column9: die sich die Schwächsten aus der Herde suchen - in diesem Fall die mit ihrem wohlfeilen Gift Korrumpierbaren. Wo immer sich ein neuer Hafen findet
column10: ankert bald ein ausländisches Schiff und rammt einen weiteren Reißzahn in den Körper unserer Nation. Der Opiumgebrauch hat sich nach $PROVINCENAME$ ausgebreitet.;;Los grandes veleros clíper navegan por nuestras costas
column12: como lobos que acechan a los débiles y corruptibles con el veneno que venden. Cuando encuentran un puerto desprotegido
column13: un barco extranjero atraca y clava su colmillo en el cuerpo de nuestra nación. El uso del opio se ha extendido a $PROVINCENAME$.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13061;The use of opium in a neighboring province has now spread to the inland. Farmers and laborers throughout $STATENAME$ fail to turn up for work
column2: and entire fields fall fallow
column3: as the people slip further and further down into the mists of consuming dependence.;L'usage de l'opium dans une province voisine s'est maintenant étendue à l'intérieur de ses terres. Les fermiers et ouvriers ne parviennent plus à se présenter au travail
column4: et des champs entiers retombent en friche
column5: les gens de $PROVINCENAME$ glissent de plus en plus dans les brumes de la dépendance. ;Der Gebrauch von Opium in einer Nachbarprovinz hat sich nun ins Inland ausgebreitet. Bauern und Arbeiter in $PROVINCENAME$ erscheinen nicht mehr zur Arbeit
column6: und komplette Felder liegen brach
column7: als die Menschen in $PROVINCENAME$ tiefer und tiefer in den Nebel der verzehrenden Sucht sinken.;;El uso del opio en una provincia vecina se ha extendido al interior. Los granjeros y los peones de $PROVINCENAME$ no han vuelto al trabajo
column8: y las cosechas de campos enteros se marchitan
column9: mientras los habitantes de $PROVINCENAME$ se sumergen cada vez más en las nieblas de la adicción.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: literally translated as 'Dutch learning'
column3: and by extension 'Western learning'
column4: is a Japanese word used to describe a particular body of knowledge and learning imported from the west via a Dutch trading station at Dejima. Something similar has ocurred at the trading station in one of our provinces
column5: where local officials are busy translating western books and treatises on science
column6: advancing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ science and understanding of the world.;;Rangaku'
column7: wörtlich übersetzt als 'Lehren der Holländer'
column8: und weitergehend als 'Lehren aus dem Westen'
column9: ist ein japanisches Wort
column11: welches aus dem Westen über einen holländische Handelsposten in Dejima nach Japan kam. Etwas Ähnliches ist am Handelsposten in $PROVINCENAME$ geschehen
column12: wo örtliche Beamte damit beschäftigt sind
column13: westliche Bücher und wissenschaftliche Abhandlungen zu übersetzen
column14: um die $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Wissenschaft und die Kenntnis von der Welt weiterzubringen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13080;He hides his face and speaks with controlled anger. A local aristocrat has been insulted by one of the foreigners living in one of our provinces. Apperantly
column2: the foreigner in question failed to bow in the appropriate manner when passing the aristocrat on the street. Shall we tolerate such blatant ignorance of our customs?;;Er verbirgt sein Gesicht und spricht mit kontrolliertem Ärger. Ein lokaler Aristokrat in $PROVINCENAME$ wurde von einem der dort lebenden Ausländer beleidigt. Offensichtlich versäumte der Ausländer
column3: sich in der korrekten Weise zu verbeugen
column4: als er dem Aristokraten auf der Straße begegnete. Sollen wir solch blatante Ignoranz unserer Sitten tolerieren?;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13090;He unveils the device with the excitement of a child. - 'You can see their eyes!'
column2: he cries
column3: pointing excitedly at the jar of beetles. He instructs you to look into the object -- the glass and metal is cold against your face -- there
column4: in curves of an optic lense
column5: reality is magnified ten times over. - 'It's a microscope!
column6: he laughs. - 'I bought it from one of the foreigners!';;Er enthüllt den Apparat mit der Begeisterung eines Kindes. - 'Man kann ihre Augen sehen!'
column7: ruft er aus und deutet aufgeregt auf das Glas mit den Käfern. Er bedeutet Ihnen
column8: in den Apparat zu schauen -- das Glas und Metall fühlt sich auf Ihrem Gesicht kalt an -- dort
column9: in den Biegungen einer optischen Linse
column10: sieht die Realität zehnmal größer aus. - 'Es ist ein Mikroskop!'
column11: lacht er. - 'Ich habe es von den Ausländern in $PROVINCENAME$ gekauft!';;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13140;Some intelligence concerning our military preparations has spread from the military mission in one of our provinces
column2: severely hurting our war effort. We have expelled the members of the mission
column3: but the damage has already been done.;Des renseignements confidentiels concernant nos préparatifs militaires ont été divulgués par la mission militaire de $PROVINCENAME$
column4: estropiant gravement notre effort de guerre. Nous avons expulsé les membres de la mission
column5: mais le mal est fait.;Einige Informationen über unsere militärischen Vorbereitungen haben sich aus der Militärmission in $PROVINCENAME$ verbreitet und schaden unseren Kriegsbemühungen enorm. Wir haben die Missionsmitglieder des Landes verwiesen
column6: aber der Schaden ist passiert.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13160;Sailors winding up drunk in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ prisons aren't normally affairs of state
column2: but this is an exception. A navyman from one of the Great Powers has been arrested by officials in one of our cities
column3: after having murdered one of our subjects in what appears to have started as a bar fight. The diplomatic attaché insists that the sailor be handed over to the country in question
column4: and tried according to their laws. This presents us with a conundrum. Granting this privilege once is tantamount to allowing extraterritoriality to all foreign subjects
column5: but not doing so might very well cause international uproar. This issue merits careful consideration.;;Betrunkene Matrosen
column6: die in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Gefängnissen landen
column7: sind üblicherweise keine Staatsaffären
column8: aber dies ist eine Ausnahme. Ein Matrose aus einer der Großmächte wurde in $PROVINCENAME$ verhaftet
column9: nachdem er einen unserer Untertanen im Verlauf einer Kneipenschlägerei umbrachte. Der diplomatische Attaché besteht darauf
column10: dass der Matrose den Gerichten seines Heimatlandes ausgeliefert und dort nach ihren Gesetzen verurteilt wird. Dies bringt uns in eine Zwickmühle. Dieses Privileg ist ein wichtiger Teil der Extraterritorialität
column12: aber wenn wir es nicht tun
column13: sehen wir einem internationalen Aufschrei entgegen. Dieses Problem muss sorgfältig durchdacht werden.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13185;A group of western expatriates currently residing in $CAPITAL$ have offered an invitation to high-ranking members of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to attend a fancy affair in the legation quarter. We're well aware that this is just an excuse for these men to gain more influence in $COUNTRY$-- but there could be benefits for us as well
column2: namely using the opportunity to gain insight into their methods.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13220;Several of the Great Powers have in the past few years sought to establish formalized and permanent embassies in $COUNTRYNAME$
column2: but up until now we've turned down their proposals. However
column3: an idea has been floating around the capital that we should perhaps allow them to set up these embasasies after all
column4: provided they are all kept in one place where we can exact some amount of control over them. Perhaps a Legation Quarter in $CAPITAL$ could be just the thing?;;Mehrere Großmächte haben in der Vergangenheit versucht
column5: formelle und permanente Botschaften in $COUNTRYNAME$ zu errichten
column6: aber bis heute haben wir ihre Ansinnen abgelehnt. Jedoch geistert eine Idee durch die Hauptstadt
column7: dass wir ihnen vielleicht doch erlauben sollten
column8: hier Botschaften zu errichten
column9: solange sie alle am selben Ort sind
column10: wo wir sie bis zu einem gewissen Grad kontrollieren können. Vielleicht wäre ein Legationsviertel in $PROVINCENAME$ genau das Richtige?;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC13230;Wandering alone in the streets of $CAPITAL$ can be a dangerous thing
column2: as a foreign ambassador in the Legation Quarter recently found out. Guards report having found him dead at 4 a.m. in the morning
column3: apperently the vicitm of a robbery
column4: however the foreigners accuse us of having failed in our supposed responsibility to protect their diplomats. We fear that even a formal apology will not be enough to placate them
column5: however
column6: something more tangible might...;;Alleine durch die Straßen von $PROVINCENAME$ zu wandern
column7: kann gefährlich sein
column8: wie ein ausländischer Botschafter im Legationsviertel neulich herausfand. Wachen fanden ihn um vier Uhr morgens tot auf
column9: offensichtlich Opfer eines Raubüberfalls. Die Ausländer aber beschuldigen uns
column12: nicht Genüge getan zu haben. Wir fürchten
column13: dass selbst eine formelle Entschuldigung nicht ausreichen wird

column1: EVTDESC13280;The reforms sweeping through our country have upset the landed elites in one of our cities.;Les réformes menées dans notre pays déplaisent aux élites foncières de $PROVINCENAME$.;Die unser Land überziehenden Reformen haben die Landbesitzereliten in $PROVINCENAME$ verärgert.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC13202;Our relations with $FROMCOUNTRY$ have worsened to the point that members of their government have begun a campaign to reduce or even eliminate $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence. Some of our diplomats have fled
column2: and now we are faced with the unpleasant prospect of either enforcing our interests or suffering embarassment at our inability to manage a former ally.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
casting an orange
column3: sooty glow across the moist brown of the cargo hold. The average ship docking in $COUNTRY$ carried very little to raise an eyebrow
column4: but years of being fooled and fooled again by foreign merchants
column5: trying to dodge some excise or other
column6: had left him with a sixth sense for when things were out of order. A rat scurrying between some crates tipped him off. A sweet
column7: pungent scent too familiar not to be alluring. Opium. A cargo hold full of opium.;;Die Öllampe flackerte und schien ein rußig-oranges Glühen über das feuchte Braun des Frachtraums. Das durchschnittlich aussehende Schiff
column8: das in $PROVINCENAME$ vor Anker lag
column9: führte wenig mit sich
column10: das auch nur ein Augenbrauenheben verursachen würde
column11: doch Jahre der Erfahrung mit ausländischen Kaufleuten
column13: ihn aufs Kreuz zu legen und Steuern zu umgehen
column14: hatten ihm einen sechsten Sinn dafür eingebracht
column15: wann etwas nicht in Ordnung war. Eine zwischen einigen Kisten umherhuschende Ratte hatte es ihm verraten. Ein süßlicher Geruch

column1: EVTDESC13365;The Righteous Society of Harmonious Fists have invaded lands currently owned by a colonial power
column2: but which rightfully belong to the Chinese. More than that
column3: they have successfully occupied the territory and rebuffed efforts by westerners to take it back. We can attempt to stake our claim over the land once again
column4: though if we do it is all but tantamount to a declaration of war-- and, considering the state the Qing Empire is in
column5: it might be a war in which we stand to lose more than we gained.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC13370;$CAPITAL$ has been occupied by the Righteous Society of Harmonious Fists
column2: who have successfully driven foreign influence out of the country and restored it to its traditional policies of isolationism. What repercussions this will cause with the western powers remains to be seen
column3: but for the moment the Empire stands triumphant.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16401;Yesterday morning we recieved a petition from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column2: requesting Statehood in the United States of Central America. A state constitution has been submitted
column3: along with maps defining the state's territorial boundries. Common opinion seems to hold it a forgone conclusion that we will accept this petition for statehood and forever join $FROMCOUNTRY$ into our prosperous $COUNTRY_ADJ$ republic.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16500;Delegates from the northern states are growing increasingly impatient with the deadlock in the senate on the issue of slavery
column2: citing what they see as an unreasonable balance of power currently controlled by southern interests. This has led to demands for a second constitutional convention and a change to a more proportional system of government based on population-- a demand adamantly opposed by the south
column3: and not universally supported even in the north.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16501;Delegates from the northern states are growing increasingly impatient with the deadlock in the senate on the issue of slavery
column2: citing what they see as an unreasonable balance of power currently controlled by southern interests. Despite the move to more proportional government
column3: things have not changed and thus there is talk that perhaps it is the north that needs to secede into a new union based on the freedom of men.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16505;Talk of secession from the Union can be heard on the streets of $PROVINCENAME$. In fact
column2: all over $STATENAME$ there is talk of secession
column3: fueled by outrage over the changes to the American constitution which have stripped states of their equality. Local sentiments seem to be turning towards the south even though $STATENAME$ is not a slave state.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16506;Talk of secession from the Union can be heard on the streets of $PROVINCENAME$. In fact
column2: all over $STATENAME$ there is talk of secession
column3: as liberals spread loud complaints over their dissatisfaction with the deadlock in the senate. They speak of a new Union based in the north
column4: based on the true freedom the fouding fathers intended.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16510;A convention of northern delegates have convened in Philadelphia to announce the formation of a new union: the Free States of America
column2: free of slavery and dedicated to true freedom for all men. The 'true' American government has decreed this the act of traitors
column3: and already is assembling its military to crush the northern secessionists. The so-called Free American government
column4: however
column5: is calling on patriots to rebel against a government held hostage to southern aristocrats and hidebound thinking.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC16515;The civil war is over... and we have lost. The United States of America that was is now gone. Delegates in $CAPITAL$ have convened to urge the government to put aside the former constitution
column2: declaring it irrelevant for the reality that now faces us. A new constitution is being drafted
column3: one heralding our place as master of the South
column4: though there are yet some who say our destiny must one day be retaken and that not all is lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC17710;Communists have been distributing literature among the working classes in one of our states. They are claiming that the common man needs to rise up against the 'bourgeois' class
column2: and that rule by the workers is the only way they can obtain fair conditions and a truly utopian society. Government officials are concerned
column3: and some say that we need to crack down hard on this kind of talk.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC17715;Socialist leanings have become quite prevalent in parts of $COUNTRY$
column2: and among these socialists radical ideas have been spreading-- namely that the common man can only achieve true freedom by overthrowing the government and establishing a rule by the working class. They cite the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government as tyrannical
column3: and one that will never bend to true reform... and the people have been listening.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC17720;The tense situation in one of our states has been aggravated by the presence of communist agitators
column2: spurring on the working classes to rise up against the government and institute a rule by the workers. We could step in
column3: but that might only provoke a rebellion. Allowing the agitators to continue spreading their propaganda
column4: however
column5: might let them get a stronger foothold in $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC17730;A communist demonstration in the streets of $PROVINCENAME$
column2: with shouts decrying the state of workers in $COUNTRY$
column3: has gained the communists a great deal of attention and sympathy throughout $STATENAME$. Attempting to crack down on these agitators may only cause the demonstrations to turn into violence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18210;A bill has come before the government in $CAPITAL$ regarding the current enfranchisement offered to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people. The discussion so far has been that expanding the voter base has led only to problems
column2: and this bill would tighten the restrictions on voting... to the point where entire groups of people would have their voting rights removed. Passing the bill would no doubt cause problems
column3: but the government seems determined to do so.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18215;A group of the ruling elite in $CAPITAL$ has recently become very concerned at reforms which have made it possible for members of the government to hold views outside of party policies. These reforms have made things too lax
column2: they say
column3: and will ultimately lead to the demise of $COUNTRY$. They've succeeded in gathering enough clout to pass a bill strengthening the power of the party whips
column4: and ensuring that the party's influence in the government remains absolute.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18220;A bill has come before the government in $CAPITAL$ regarding the rights of the press. Many feel that the reforms have allowed the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ newspapers to become combative with the government
column2: inciting dissension and making the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people harder to control. This control is necessary
column3: they say
column4: if $COUNTRY$ is to remain strong and united. While some might be upset by the bill's passing
column5: the government appears entrenched in its position.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18225;A bill has come before the government in $CAPITAL$ regarding the rights of the people to gather. Many feel that reforms have allowed the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people to become too liberated-- they gather in crowds
column2: protesting the government and otherwise stirring the rest of the rabble. Once upon a time
column3: they say
column4: this simply wouldn't have been allowed. New rules must be put in place to limit the number of people that can meet in one place
column5: and for what purpose. While some might be upset by the bill's passing
column6: the government appears entrenched in its position.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18230;Members of the ruling party have been busy within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column2: slowly changing small rules that would make it difficult for opposition parties to get recognized and elected. Political boundaries have been shifted
column3: and in some cases members of the opposition have even been harassed. Now it seems a bill has been put before the government which would entrench a large number of these rules
column4: making them permanent. The government is adamant
column5: saying the rules are needed to keep stability in $COUNTRY$
column6: though the bill will no doubt be incredibly unpopular among the liberals.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18501;Ours is a nation of equality
column2: where no man is placed above another in importance. Everyone strives for the betterment of all. A recent report in a $CAPITAL$ newspaper regarding the arrest of a wealthy but criminal industrialist has served not to outrage the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people
column3: but rather to reinforce their ideals. Today our people walk a little more proudly than before.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18506;Ours is a nation of liberty
column2: where every man is born with the inherent right to seek his own destiny. The possibility of prosperity lies within every man's reach. A recent report in a $CAPITAL$ newspaper regarding the acquittal of a man popularly believed to be innocent has served to reinforce our peoples' ideals. Today they walk a little more proudly than before.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18507;It has been often said that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are accustomed to freedom-- they strive for it
column2: hold it as the greatest of ideals. So it is that they chafe under the yoke of what they see as the government's tyranny. A recent demonstration in one of our cities threatens to spread throughout the state. With the eyes of the world upon us
column3: however
column4: forcefully putting an end to this act of civil disobedience will no doubt be seen as an attack upon our own citizens.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18510;In the eyes of our soldiers as they parade through the streets
column2: nothing can be seen but utmost devotion to $COUNTRYNAME$ and the ideals for which our nation stands. These men
column3: and the description fits them
column4: have been fostered since childhood into rigid and firm belief in our nation
column5: and they would die to defend it. Long live $COUNTRY$!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18511;Ours is a nation of might
column2: where a man's strength determines his success and everyone knows very well how superior we are to our neighbours. None can hope to compare to $COUNTRY$ on our best day. A recent report in a $CAPITAL$ newspaper regarding the execution of a foreigner believed to have been engaged in criminal activities on $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soil has served to reinforce our peoples' beliefs. Today they walk a little more proudly than before.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18515;Matters in $COUNTRY$ are getting out of hand. Acts of violence are becoming more commonplace
column2: and some claim that revolution is in the air. Many citizens in $CAPITAL$ are calling on the government to take stronger measures. Sending our army to deal with the violence will
column3: however
column4: only bring the attention of the world upon us. Perhaps this is a time to prove that $COUNTRY$ can deal with its affairs in the way we always have-- with civility.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18517;Ours is a nation of order
column2: where peace and civility rule the day. Everyone strives for the common good
column3: and for the progress of our nation as a whole. A recent report in a $CAPITAL$ newspaper regarding the arrest of a prominent criminal figure who had previously eluded authorities has not outraged the people
column4: but rather has served to reinforce their beliefs. Today the people of $COUNTRY$ walk a little more proudly than before.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18521;A celebration in $CAPITAL$ took place this month
column2: a sombre affair following the death of a prominent politician. This was a celebration of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way: peace
column3: brotherhood and fraternity. Such were the virtues this man believed in
column4: and it is a belief shared by all the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18525;A celebration in $CAPITAL$ took place this month
column2: a sombre affair following the death of a prominent politician. This was a celebration of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way: freedom
column3: liberty and the pursuit of happiness. Such were the virtues in which this man believed
column4: and it is a belief shared by all the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18531;A recent dispute with one of our neighbours has had an electrifying effect upon the people of $COUNTRY$: 'How can they be allowed to treat us this way?'
column2: they ask. Some are calling for war
column3: while others are satisfied with the knowledge that our nation has already come out on top.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18535;A celebration in $CAPITAL$ took place this month
column2: a sombre affair following the death of a prominent politician. This was a celebration of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way: order
column3: industry and productivity. Such were the virtues in which this man believed
column4: and it is a belief shared by all the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18550;Our people have attempted to embrace the ideals of westernization for a long time
column2: but now there is a growing movement to return to the traditional $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way of life. It falls to the nation's leaders to set the example: should we embrace the ideal of tradition once again
column3: or should westernization remain our goal despite our continuing isolation?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18551;Our people have held to our traditions for a very long time. After many years of exposure to the western nations
column2: however
column3: a growing movement has begun to change the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way of life. Intellectuals in $CAPITAL$ say the government should lead the people into an era of progress and not remain mired in our backward ways. Shall we throw these fools into prison
column4: or consider what they have to say?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18555;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ intellectuals have clashed with members of the aristocracy in $CAPITAL$. The aristocracy has accused the intellectual elite of attempting to cast aside the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ way of life
column2: while the intellectuals say that progress is necessary if $COUNTRY$ is to have any chance against western imperialist powers. The argument of the intellectuals is convincing
column3: but this has not calmed matters in the streets.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18556;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ intellectuals have brought several new ideas before the court
column2: ideas that could advance our research considerably. They are also quite contentious
column3: however
column4: and a rejection of the intellectuals could do much to soothe the aristocracy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18560;The peasants are taking to the streets
column2: rising up against their rulers in ways that would have been unthinkable only decades ago. Perhaps it is time to remind them of their duty to their nation
column3: and of the traditions which have served $COUNTRY$ so well in ages past?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18561;A great celebration has been held in $CAPITAL$ in honor of $COUNTRY$'s rulers
column2: as well as its centuries of honorable tradition. Massive crowds appeared to cheer on our soldiers
column3: and the spectacle has even drawn the attention of foreigners. Shall we dedicate the celebration to $COUNTRY$'s greatness
column4: or shall we instead use it as an excuse to appease the masses?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18562;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ reactionaries have begun heated debates in one of our states
column2: arguing that $COUNTRY$ should not be slavishly seeking to chase after 'civilized' nations-- indeed
column3: that already $COUNTRY$ has gone too far down the path of degradation and that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people suffer for it. They are calling on the government to repeal reforms
column4: or at the very least to slow down the rapid pace of change... and they are gaining a wide audience.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18565;$COUNTRY$ is a nation of progress
column2: and our current period of insulation against the western powers runs contrary to that ideal. Shall we call on the borders to be opened once again? It might anger some of our people
column3: but the flow of goods and ideas is invaluable to our prosperity.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18571;We never wanted this contact with the westerners. They bring too many problems into our country
column2: and their influence spreads like an insidious disease. Many in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ court are calling for the borders to be closed once again
column3: for us to display to these imperialists that they cannot simply strut about our nation as if they own it. A display of force is necessary!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19007;Tensions between ourselves and other Great Powers have erupted regarding dominance over the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government. We are forced into a position where we must either assert our position
column2: which will be seen as undercutting $FROMCOUNTRY$'s independence
column3: or back down and lose much of the influence in $FROMCOUNTRY$ we currently hold.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19365;An idea has been spreading among the people of $COUNTRY$... some of our lands are under foreign control
column2: but it appears to be beyond our power to regain them on our own. $COUNTRY$ has a great power as its benevolent protector
column3: however
column4: does it not? The people are urging our government to approach them for aid
column5: though some within the government are concerned this could possibly alienate our ally as well
column6: not to mention stir up new hostility with our neighbors.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19366;Diplomats from $FROMCOUNTRY$ have quietly approached us
column2: appealing for help in restoring their lost lands. With $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column3: they say
column4: $FROMCOUNTRY$ will prove a much worthier ally. There are those concerned with the trouble this might stir up
column5: however. Should we look the other way
column6: our prove $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence has weight?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19367;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to consider our proposal. It's possible they will
column2: in the end
column3: take no military action on our behalf… it's come to our attention that relations between them and one of our neighbours has cooled severely
column4: however
column5: so a war may yet come to pass.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC19368;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to intervene on our behalf. Worse
column2: it appears the purpose of our mission has leaked to at least one of our neighbours
column3: angering them greatly bringing threats of war against $COUNTRY$. Did $FROMCOUNTRY$ inform them? Have we been abandoned by our ally?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: accompanying the new $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ governor who will be overseeing the operation of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ puppet government. Already the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are up in arms over this imposition by a foreign power
column3: though some are clearly questioning whether there is anything to be done. $COUNTRY$ did not submit willingly
column4: after all
column5: and if a rebellion breaks us free of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ control would they not simply invade once again? Perhaps $COUNTRY$ has suffered enough.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31510;Austrians have always walked a path slightly apart from those of their fellow Germans
column2: and the notion of greater unification has never caught on in Austria as it has in the north. Lately there are those who say Austria's unquestioned dominance obligates it to unite Greater Germany under a single flag. Still others say that
column3: no
column4: Austria already has its own name and empire
column5: one that stretches over many cultures who would never welcome becoming more dominated by the Germans... not to mention that a Greater Germany would alarm the powers of Europe to such a degree it would almost surely herald a war. Thus the question arises: what shall our path be?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31511;We have been granted limited self-government by $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: in the interest of gaining our acquiescence to their formation of a Greater Germany. There are those within $COUNTRY$ who object
column3: saying that being a German vassal is no better than what we enjoyed previously. But it is something.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31515;Austrians have always walked a path slightly apart from those of their fellow Germans
column2: and the notion of greater unification has never caught on in Austria as it has in the north. Lately there are those who question that path
column3: citing the ascension of a great power who stands ready to lead us into a Greater Germany. Considering that non-German cultures within Austria would never accept dominance by such a union
column4: and that it would alarm European powers to an unprecedented degree
column5: we have to wonder where our path should now lie?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31516;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government met with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in $CAPITAL$ today
column2: expressing their desire to unite into a 'Greater Germany'. They do so with the full intent of incorporating not only their German-speaking territories
column3: but also any lands they own belonging to other cultures. While such a Greater Germany would undoubtedly be a power unheard-of in the world
column4: there are those who express caution: the world's great powers would almost certainly object to such a union
column5: not to mention the fact that the non-Germany cultures would likely rebel against our dominance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31518;There has been much talk in $CAPITAL$ in recent days of possible unification with $FROMCOUNTRY$ into a 'Greater Germany'. This talk was finally shot down by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column2: which stated that $FROMCOUNTRY$'s path is separate from $COUNTRY$'s. There are those within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column3: however
column4: who believe this is unacceptable. While it would undoubtedly destroy our relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$ and upset the powers of Europe
column5: laying a claim to the German-speaking parts of $FROMCOUNTRY$ is a possibility.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31519;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government met with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in $CAPITAL$ today
column2: expressing their desire to unite into a 'Greater Germany'. Their only stipulation on the union is that their non-German states be incorporated as self-governing regions
column3: no doubt to minimize the objection of European powers-- though there are those who believe the European powers will be unhappy with such an arrangement even so.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31521;Austria is no more. With Vienna gone and what remains of the Empire a disarray of governments unwilling to maintain their cohesion without an Austrian government to hold it together
column2: the nation has split apart at the seams. Whole portions of the Empire have either declared their outright independence or their intention to reunite with their homelands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31530;Austrians have always walked a path slightly apart from those of their fellow Germans
column2: and the notion of greater unification has never caught on in Austria as it has in the north. Lately there are those who question that path
column3: citing the ascension of a great power who stands ready to lead us into a Greater Germany. Considering such a union could alarm the powers of Europe to a great degree
column4: we have to wonder where our path should now lie?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31531;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government met with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in $CAPITAL$ today
column2: expressing their desire to unite into a 'Greater Germany'. While such a nation would undoubtedly be a power unheard-of in the world
column3: there are those who express caution: the world's great powers would likely object to such a union. Is Greater Germany worth the possibility of war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32509_NEW;We hear word from the Russian ambassador that they are willing to sell their Alaskan colony to us
column2: for the right price. Perhaps we should consider making an offer before someone else snaps it up? The land isn't worth much at the moment
column3: but owning Alaska would be a boon to our prestige.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32510_NEW;We have received an offer from $FROMCOUNTRY$ to purchase the Alaskan colony. Should we accept?;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC32512;The Hungarian revolution in Austria sets a dangerous precedent. There are far too many minorities in $COUNTRY$ who might look to the Hungarians as an inspiration
column2: and who would rise up as well if we do not set a firm example. No matter our relation with the Austrian government
column3: we must consider intervention against the Hungarian rebels or possibly face similar uprisings at home.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32515;Now that Finland is free from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule
column2: their government has approached us to engage in territorial talks. They are interested in the northern strip of land known as Petsamo
column3: and the access to the Arctic Ocean it offers
column4: as well as discussing Russian claims to Viipuri. If we give them what they're looking for
column5: $COUNTRY$ looks good in the eyes of the international community and we gain an ally-- but perhaps we do not need Finland as an ally?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32516;Russia has refused to sign the Treaty of Tartu
column2: raising the spectre of war between our nations. Perhaps we should consider surrendering southern Karelia before the Russians come and take it from us?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC32550;Central American delegates have recently come in from London in hopes of purchasing British Belize. What should we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC32551;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sell Belize to us! Long live the United States of Central America!;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: negotiations with $FROMCOUNTRY$ over Belize have stalled
column3: and they have declined to sell us the colony.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC33006;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a proposition: a trade of one of our colonial states in exchange for the island of Heligoland. It's an exorbitant price for such a small island
column2: but the alternative would be to go to war. Shall we agree to the treaty?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC33007;Germany has agreed to the proposed trade for Heligoland.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC33008;Germany has refused the proposed trade for Heligoland.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC33009;The lands of Alsace-Lorraine rightfully belong in the hands of the German people. Perhaps the time has come to reclaim them from the French
column2: and show the world what a united and glorious Germany can achieve? Either that or perhaps we should renounce our claims to those lands once and for all
column3: despite the blow to our prestige and our pride.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC33010;We have failed to recover Alsace-Lorraine from the hated French. Many are suggesting we should renounce our claims and move on
column2: despite the blow to our national pride.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC33020;The German Kaiser has sent a delegation to $COUNTRY$ with a proposal: a resurrection of the Holy Alliance formed between Prussia
column2: Austria and Russia which once existed after the defeat of Napoleon. It seems doubtful that such an alliance could bear fruit
column3: but perhaps it is time to consider this idea. $COUNTRY$ has other concerns than constant conflict with the Germans
column4: after all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC33025;With the loss of our colonial base in Manila
column2: the administration of the Pacific Islands has become incredibly difficult. We have been approached by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government regarding the possibility of selling any of our remaining holdings in the Caroline and Mariana Islands. The amount offered is not much
column3: but then again the islands are not worth much-- indeed
column4: they cost us far more than they provide. There is the additional notion that
column5: should we disagree
column6: $FROMCOUNTRY$ might attempt to take them by force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC35305;The lands of Tripoli and Cyrenaica once belonged to Italy
column2: and should again. We deserve a place in the sun!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36215_NEW;The Icelandic Althing has voted to request they be granted home rule
column2: saying the time has come for greater independence. Under their plan
column3: $COUNTRY$ would continue to manage the nation's foreign affairs and defense interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36709;While Belgium's de facto independence from the Netherlands had been established by force of arms during the Belgian Revolution of 1831
column2: it has not been confirmed de jure and we yet hold claims over Belgian territory. The British have offered to mediate a settlement-- in return for the surrendering of our claims and a guarantee of Belgium's neutrality
column3: we would receive the Rhenish part of Luxembourg as our vassal… as well as a great deal of standing in the eyes of the European powers. That is
column4: of course
column5: if Belgium even agrees to the treaty.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36710;In a meeting mediated by the British
column2: the Netherlands has offered to sign a treaty which would see them relinquish all claims to Belgian territory-- but at the cost of surrendering Luxembourg to them as a vassal. Some are claiming this is too high a price
column3: and that we should not allow ourselves to be bullied into such a treaty... but this may also be the only chance we have at peace with the Dutch.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36711;The Belgian government has agreed to the terms of the Treaty of London. We have surrendered all claims to their territory
column2: in return for control over Luxembourg.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36712;The Belgian government has refuse the terms of the Treaty of London. This is a foolish move that only opens up the possibility of more war
column2: but it seems the Belgians will not be moved.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the unthinkable has happened: Amsterdam has fallen. It seems there is little choice but to surrender to the Belgians and allow them to dictate terms. If they are kind
column3: they will simply force us to relinquish all claims to the southern Netherlands. If they are unkind
column4: they may force us to give up territory-- though doing so will surely bring about the wrath of the European powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36716;Our forces have consolidated their control over Amsterdam and proven their superiority in the war
column2: and thus the Dutch government has little choice but to accept any terms we dictate. The European powers are pushing for peace and conciliation -- they wish to see that Belgium keeps what it has and nothing more -- though if we dare risk their wrath we could certainly wrest territorial considerations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36950;The Danish Gold Coast exists on the coast of the Ashanti Union
column2: primarily the fortress of Chistiansborg near the city of Accra. The Danish are willing to sell their holdings to us
column3: though that is likely to result in conflict with the Ashanti government-- who will see the move as encroachment of their territory.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36955;A British Commodore who was recently dispatched to Burma to negotiate several matters regarding the Treaty of Yandabo
column2: signed in 1826 after the First Anglo-Burmese War
column3: has initiated a naval confrontation with the Burmese under questionable circumstances. While many are calling this Commodore an 'irrational jingoist'
column4: the British cannot let this matter drop without losing a great deal of prestige.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36960;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has approached us with the hopes of negotiating a treaty. They want to solidify control over the Gold Coast in Africa
column2: specifically by annexing our colony at Sekondi. In return
column3: they will recognize our colonial holdings elsewhere and encourage greater cooperation between our nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36965;We outlawed the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ slave trade many years ago
column2: but it continues in many African nations-- and the coastal city of Lagos in particular. Lagos has been a haven for slavers
column3: providing unwilling natives to the trade on markets in defiance of all decent conventions. The notion has arisen that we should consider sending our ships in to liberate the natives there and establish a colony where they can receive civilized government.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36966;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ships have sailed into Lagos
column2: seizing the city and driving off the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ garrison. They claim they are 'liberating' the city from slavers
column3: extending their benevolent rule on behalf of the locals. Resisting means war
column4: but submitting would do nothing more than prove our lack of ability to face these foreigners. What should we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36970;With the 'International Commission for the Piercing of the Isthmus of Suez' having completed
column2: and assessed the Suez region as being possible to have a canal built
column3: all that remains is to put the plan in motion. The Suez Canal Company intends to do just that, but in order for it to start it needs to put together a significant amount of capital-- thus it has been offering shares to various governments
column4: hoping as well for the political clout to influence Egypt into allowing the venture to proceed.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC36975;We have received disturbing reports of rebellion in Egypt
column2: on a scale where our interests in the Suez might become threatened. While it undoubtedly would appear to some that we are using this as an excuse
column3: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government cannot idly stand by and watch such an important project be laid to waste by the ignorant. We must consider direct intervention.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37219_NEW;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in Asia for many years now
column2: but they have encountered considerable persecution at the hands of Asian authorities. In Dai Nam
column3: the execution of several missionaries has prompted the society to ask the French government for diplomatic intervention. This has gone nowhere
column4: leaving us with little choice but to consider armed intervention.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
