column1: EVTDESC37230;The island of Tahiti in the Pacific Ocean
column2: ruled by the primitive Queen Pomare IV
column3: expelled two French catholic priests several years ago. Admiral Abel Aubert Dupetit-Thouars was dispatched to get reparations for the deed, but then proceeded-- without authorization-- to gain a request from the Queen's chiefs to request a protectorate
column4: a treaty to which he then demanded the Queen acquiesce. We can approve the treaty
column5: gaining use of Tahiti as a staging ground in the Pacific
column6: but it may cause friction with the British Empire considering British colonists are also on the island.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37710;A new line of the Bourbon family has been established on the Spanish throne
column2: descending from the Infante Carlos. To many traditionalists
column3: this signals a rebirth of the true Spanish Empire. Others are not so optimistic.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37711;The death of King Ferdinand in 1833 and the ascension of young Isabela (only three years old at the time) to the throne of Spain sparked a revolt by supporters of the King's brother
column2: the Infante Carlos. He intends to depose Isabela and establish a separate branch of the Bourbon family
column3: as well as restore the Spanish Empire to its traditional glory-- something liberals say simply cannot be done.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37712;The Carlists have been routed and peace has been restored to Spain-- for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC37713;We thought the supporters of the Infante Carlos and his descendants had been completely routed
column2: yet once again there are reports of a cell having been established in one of our provinces. Supporters of the current pretender are busy drumming up recruits and calling for the overthrow of the Spanish government. Rooting them out will not be easy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37714;It seems that sympathies for the Carlists among the locals in $PROVINCENAME$ have been increasing. Reports have it that another rebel cell has been established
column2: and that a campaign of resistance against Spanish authorities has begun.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37715;The Carlist cell in $PROVINCENAME$ has been found! After a battle with authorities
column2: the majority of the rebels have been either captured or executed. We have found good information in their base
column3: including the names of many of their supporters throughout $PROVINCENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the pretender king driven into the provinces
column3: and the original royal line descending from Ferdinand VII has been restored to the Spanish throne. Many liberals are breathing a sigh of relief
column4: but reactionaries are furious. Already supporters of the pretender are seeking new allies in the countryside.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37717;The supporters of the former royal line still exist
column2: and we have begun to receive reports of a Christino cell having been established in one of our provinces. They are gaining a great deal of support among liberals in the province with their calls for an overthrow of the 'pretender' on the throne. The cell is well-hidden
column3: and rooting them out will not be easy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37718;It seems that sympathies for the Christinos among the locals in $PROVINCENAME$ have been increasing. Reports have it that another rebel cell has been established
column2: and that a campaign of resistance against Spanish authorities has begun.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37719;The Christino cell in $PROVINCENAME$ has been found! After a battle with authorities
column2: the majority of the rebels have been either captured or executed. We have found good information in their base
column3: including the names of many of their supporters throughout $PROVINCENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37720;The death of Leopoldo O'Donnell has eroded Queen Isabella's support
column2: to the point where a movement to overthrow her has rapidly developed. A mutiny by naval officers in Cadiz has provided the spark for a widespread revolt against Isabella's rule. Her chief minister and generals have deserted her
column3: and Isabella was forced to flee into exile. For the moment
column4: Spain stands without a ruler
column5: and the provisional government argues over what its next step should be. Some favor abandoning the monarchy altogether
column6: but most feel a new king should be selected. Isabella's heir
column7: Prince Alfonso
column8: is thought by many to be too much under her influence. Other choices are the moderate Prince Leopold of Hohenzollern and the liberal Prince Amadeo of Savoy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37721;With Queen Isabella II having been deposed by a revolt
column2: the Spanish provisional government has been busy seeking a new monarch to assume the throne... and among the candidates considered was Prince Leopold of Hohenzollern. Our government objected strongly to the move
column3: as this would spread Prussian influence to our southern border
column4: and while this did convince Prince Leopold to turn down the throne it has not endeared us to the Prussians.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37722;With Queen Isabella II having been deposed by a revolt
column2: the Spanish provisional government has been busy seeking a new monarch... and the candidate they have chosen is none other than Prince Leopold of Hohenzollern. A German prince on the Spanish throne is a direct threat to our nation's security. We must do something about this immediately!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
controversial since his ascension to the throne and constantly balked in the royal courts by moarchists advocating a return to the Bourbon line
column3: was shot dead in his carriage shortly after arriving in Madrid following a country outing. The country is left in chaos and once again without a monarch on the throne.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: controversial since his ascension and constantly balked in the royal courts by moarchists advocating a return to the Bourbon line
column3: has angrily declared Spain to be 'ungovernable' after the Hidalgo Affair forced him into conflict with the nation's military and has abdicated the throne. The country is left in chaos and once again without a monarch.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37735;The Spanish Republic has been contentious since its inception. After a series of failed governments
column2: many Spaniards have come to favor a return to the stability of Bourbon rule. In a coup led by Brigadier General Martinez Campos
column3: the Republican army has declared its alliegiance to Prince Alfonso-- son of the exiled Queen Isabella II-- and named him King of Spain.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37740;We are losing the war with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: and it's only a matter of time before we're forced to submit to a humiliating defeat. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has made it clear it considers our colonial holdings to be beyond our ability to control
column3: and is willing to purchase them for a 'fair' price. Failure to submit to their demands will mean the war dragging on to its inevitable conclusion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37741;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has signed the Treaty of Paris. Their colonial holdings are ours
column2: for a price.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37742;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sign the Treaty of Paris. The war continues!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC37743;The Carlists have been spreading their propaganda into neighboring $PROVINCENAME$
column2: and reports have it that their lies are finding a ready audience among the locals. We can put a stop to their efforts
column3: though not without being rather indiscriminate in our arrests and reprisals among $PROVINCENAME$'s poor. Still
column4: radical measures may be called for in order to stop the Carlists from gaining headway here.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37744;The Christinos have been spreading their propaganda into neighboring $PROVINCENAME$
column2: and reports have it that their lies are finding a ready audience among the locals. We can put a stop to their efforts
column3: though not without being rather indiscriminate in our arrests and reprisals among $PROVINCENAME$'s poor. Still
column4: radical measures may be called for in order to stop the Christinos from gaining headway here.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37745;A heated dispute has arisen between the Moroccans and our government over the boundaries of our holdings in Melilla. Some believe the Moroccans are attempting to gain sympathy from the French
column2: but we have it on good authority that there will be no aid coming for them. Now may be the time for us to exert some of our authority over this African upstart.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC37750;We have lost the war with the Americans
column2: and Cuba has been wrested from our grasp. The American government has approached us intent on a treaty
column3: suggesting we no longer have the power to hold onto our Pacific and North American colonies. They seek to offer us a 'reasonable' price for them. Some in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ govrnment fear that
column4: if we do not agree
column5: it could mean further wars with the Americans for years to come.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we have lost the war against the Spanish. They retain their hold over Cuba and their other colonies. The American people are understandably shaken
column3: but it seems their jingoistic fervor has only increased. A streak of anti-colonialism has arisen throughout the country
column4: specifically targeting the powers of 'Old Europe'. Newspapers are demanding we gear up to liberate these colonies once and for all. If we agree
column5: some fear this may be a tiger we cannot again cage.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC38505;The death of Sa'id bin Sultan Al-Busaid has left him with two sons
column2: each of which has claimed Oman as their own to rule. The result of this struggle has brought in foreign mediation
column3: with the resulting decree that the nation will be split into two sultanates: one in Zanzibar and one in Muscat
column4: each ruled by one of Al-Basaid's sons.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44122;We have concluded a treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: resolving several long-standing border disputes between our nations. In particular
column3: the treaty has clearly established the border between Maine and the British colony of New Brunswick.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44125;Mexico is not properly utilizing the lands between ours and the Pacific. It is our destiny to bring American rule and prosperity to all of North America
column2: and our responsibility to take these lands from Mexico so they may flourish. To avoid further war with Mexico
column3: we should approach their government and see if they will consider selling these lands to us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44126;The American ambassador has informed us that it would be in our best interests to sell the lands north of the Rio Grande to the United States. The amount they offer is considerable
column2: and the northwest territories are of limited value to us
column3: but it is almost an insult that they would think us so eager to give up our rightful territory.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44127;The Mexicans have refused our generous offer. Our only recourse is force of arms.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC44140;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to inquire about the possibility of purchasing our territory in northern Alaska. The land is not valuable
column2: and since previous $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ claims to the area will no doubt only lead to conflict
column3: we should perhaps consider the sale.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44141;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sell the Alaskan territory. Considering that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people already consider the territory rightfully ours
column2: many are calling for war to reclaim the land.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44145;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to inquire about the possibility of purchasing our Pacific Island territories near Hawaii. The land is not valuable
column2: and previous $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ claims to the area will no doubt only lead to conflict. We should perhaps consider the sale.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44146;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sell the Hawaiian Islands territory. Considering the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people already consider the territory rightfully ours
column2: many are calling for war to reclaim the land.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44150;As American and British settlers begin to move to the west coast of North America
column2: there has been a growing dispute as to who owns the Oregon Country. The entire region west of the Rockies (called Columbia by the British) has been explored by both countries and there are legitimate claims on either side. The British claim all the way south to the 42nd Parallel and the Americans north to the 54th Parallel. It's clearly a tense situation
column3: and the specter of war with the British looms as politicians in the current election campaign are banging the drums of Manifest Destiny in order to gain support.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44151;As American and British settlers begin to move to the west coast of North America
column2: there has been a growing dispute as to who owns the Columbia District. The entire region west of the Rockies (called the Oregon Country by the Americans) has been explored by both countries and there are legitimate claims on either side. The British claim all the way south to the 42nd Parallel and the Americans north to the 54th Parallel. The situation is tense
column3: and made more so by jingoistic American politicians calling for sovereignty over the entire continent. Even so
column4: the American government has sent a delegation seeking a compromise in the region.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44153;The talks with the British have broken down
column2: primarily due to the continuing calls by war-mongering politicians. Neither of our options now is very pleasant: either we abandon our claims to Oregon no matter what some might think
column3: or we press ahead with the claims and brace for eventual war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44154;As American and British settlers begin to move to the west coast of North America
column2: there has been a growing dispute as to who owns the Columbia District. The entire region west of the Rockies (called the Oregon Country by the Americans) has been explored by both countries and there are legitimate claims on either side. Recently the situation has been exacerbated by American politicians rattling their sabers over their idea of 'Manifest Destiny'
column3: and they have pressed their claim all the way north to the 54th Parallel. It will almost certainly mean war
column4: and our only consideration should probably be whether we wish to pursue another costly war with the Americans in North America when our time could better be spent elsewhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44155;The British have elected to withdraw from Oregon and have signed a treaty to hand any American land over to us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC44303;It has taken time to settle the grievances following the Riel Rebellion
column2: but treaties with the various Metis groups throughout the North-West territories have managed to properly incorporate them into Canada.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44305;Perhaps inspired by the American Revolution
column2: colonists in both the Lower Canada and Upper Canada colonies have risen up in rebellion. They are frustrated by the lack of political reform
column3: as well as the entrenched power held by the reactionary elites of the 'Family Compact'
column4: and agitators are demanding responsible government if not outright independence. The colonial government has moved to arrest the perpetrators as traitors to the crown.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44306;Lord Durham has returned from his mission to investigate the causes of the rebellion in Upper and Lower Canada with recommendations to the British crown-- namely that the two colonies be united under a single responsible government through an Act of Union. He fears that
column2: if we do not
column3: we may be facing further rebellion just as was faced in America. Indeed
column4: it is entirely possible the Canadian radicals could attract support from the Americans if they are not appeased.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44310;A gathering of governors from our Maritime colonies in North America has also been attended by governors from Canada. According to reports
column2: they are attempting to organize a larger confederation of the colonies with an eye towards eventual self-government. We would like to see the North American colonies be more self-reliant
column3: so it may be in our best interest to allow this union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44315;The colonial government of Canada has officially requested that the crown permit them self-governance. This will see the colony better able to protect itself without military support
column2: and considering their united stance it's entirely possible that should we refuse we will see renewed rebellion there.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44316;The colonial government of Quebec has officially requested that the crown permit them self-governance. This will see the colony better able to protect itself without military support
column2: and considering their united stance it's entirely possible that should we refuse we will see renewed rebellion there.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44317;The colonial governments of the Maritimes have officially requested that the crown permit them self-governance. This will see the colonies better able to protect themselves without military support
column2: and considering their united stance it's entirely possible that should we refuse we will see rebellion there.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44318;The colonial government of British Columbia has officially requested that the crown permit them self-governance. This will see the colony better able to protect itself without military support
column2: and considering their united stance it's entirely possible that should we refuse we will see rebellion there.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44322;A British act which would have seen us offered the rights to purchase all of Rupert's Land from the Hudson's Bay Company has been defeated. Canadian dreams of uniting the continent from the Atlantic to the Pacific have been dashed in one fell swoop! Citizens in $CAPITAL$ are outraged at this betrayal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and thus the dream of a larger Canadian confederation has resurfaced. Delegates from $FROMCOUNTRY$ have made the journey to $CAPITAL$ with the goal of negotiating terms of joining our nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44339;The land north of the 60th parallel is inhospitable to settlers
column2: but there is a growing concern that should the Canadian government not move to fully claim the territory another power will do so. It will take considerable political capital to convince the other world powers of Canadian dominion in the north
column3: but many feel we must make the effort... and considering there are reports of gold in the Yukon it might be wise to do so.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44351;Representatives from British Columbia have met with Canadian delegates in $CAPITAL$ to discuss terms of their joining confederation. The only thing that appears to interest them is the building of a national railway linking the Pacific and the Atlantic. Without it
column2: they say
column3: the nation is too divided and they are more connected with other regions along the Pacific coast.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44355;The first stage of the Canadian National Railway
column2: linking Winnipeg to the Atlantic Coast
column3: has been completed. Now work must begin on the second stage
column4: which will be considerably more difficult.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44356;The second stage of the Canadian National Railway
column2: linking Calgary to the Atlantic Coast
column3: has been completed. Now work must begin on the last stage
column4: which will be the longest and most difficult yet as it requires creating a pass through the Rocky Mountains themselves.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44357;After a massive effort expended to create a pass through the Rocky Mountains
column2: the Canadian National Railway has been completed! A single railway now links the Pacific coast to the Atlantic. Crowds have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to celebrate the first locomotive being sent to make the complete journey!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44805;A general and war hero of Mexican independence
column2: Santa Anna was elected President in 1833. After deposing his liberal vice-president
column3: Santa Anna abrogated the 1826 Constitution and took control of the country as a conservative dictator with both church and military backing. Many Mexican states objected to this centralization of power
column4: and with the rebellion of Tejas to the north the entire country seems to be in a state of chaos.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44810;Malcontents in $STATENAME$ have risen up in defiance of the government
column2: demanding a return to democratic rule!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44815;The rebel state of Tejas has been recaptured. A glorious victory for Mexico
column2: and a blow against the malcontents who seek to spread dissension and discord!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44820;Inspired by the success of the Tejas rebellion
column2: liberal malcontents in the provinces along the Rio Grande have risen up and declared their independence from Mexico.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44821;Angered by the abrogation of the 1824 Constitution and the centralization of government power in Mexico City
column2: liberals in the Yucatan have declared their independence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Mexican government will come after our country and seek to re-incorporate it into the federation. If we are to survive
column3: joining the United Provinces of Central America may be our only hope. Shall we make the request?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44825;With our capital under American control
column2: it seems we have little choice but to negotiate. The Americans have offered us a deal: the normalization of relations
column3: the forgiveness of our debt and the payment of a great deal of money... all in exchange for a cession of all the northern territories currently claimed by their country. If we refuse
column4: it may mean many years more of war for us until these Americans get what they want.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44826;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo
column2: ceding all American-claimed territory to our control. For now
column3: the relations between our two countries can return to normal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44827;Despite having them over the figurative barrel
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has refused to capitulate to our demands. So much the worse for them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44830;Emperor Maximilian has never enjoyed popular support in Mexico
column2: and now that insurgents led by Benito Juárez have captured him it seems his reign has come to an end. Court-martialed and executed by a firing squad
column3: the new republic was declared only days after his death. Benito Juárez has assumed the role of President of Mexico.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: General of Mexico and considered a hero by some
column3: has overthrown the democratic government of Mexico in a military coup. Planned in secret with several military officers and announced in Oaxaca
column4: it has disavowed the presidency of Sebastián Lerdo de Tejada and installed Diaz as a military-backed dictator.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the leader of Mexico -- General Antonio de Santa Anna himself -- has been captured. Found running through the countryside
column3: attempting to escape back to Mexico
column4: he has been imprisoned in a Texan jail and forced to negotiate. We can force the man to agree to a peace treaty -- even though many consider the odds of Santa Anna's own country agreeing to terms exacted under duress to be slight
column5: it may be our only hope against overwhelming odds. At the very least
column6: the humiliation dealt against their leader will be a blow against the Mexican government and one from which they will not soon recover.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44841;In a humiliating blow to Mexico's prestige
column2: General Santa Anna has been captured within Texan territory-- separated from our army and found wandering the countryside in an attempt to return to Mexico. While imprisoned
column3: he agreed to a series of treaties which recognized Texan independence among other guarantees... all in exchange for his safe return. We are now faced with a question: while the treaties are worthless
column4: disregarding them completely could give the Americans a cause to intervene. Either way
column5: one thing is certain: as the architect of this fiasco
column6: Santa Anna's time in power is done.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44842;While Mexico had every reason to refute the treaties signed by Santa Anna
column2: it seems their willingness to continue the war against Texas has waned. They will not embarass themselves further
column3: and have agreed to let us remain free in exchange for Santa Anna's return. For the moment
column4: this means the war with Mexico is over... whether that peace will continue remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Mexican government has refuted the Treaties of Velasco and refused to negotiate for Santa Anna's return. They are
column3: however
column4: evidently afraid that the treaties have enough validity that ignoring them would give the Americans an excuse to intervene-- and have called for a ceasefire. How long it will last is unknown
column5: but for the moment Texas has its respite.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Mexico has ignored the terms of the Treaties of Velasco-- claiming that Santa Anna only agreed to them under duress. Indeed
column3: Santa Anna himself has been quick to back up their claim even despite his precarious position. The one bright light in this? It might be the cause the American government has been looking for to intervene in our war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44845;Despite the assurances supposedly offered by the Treaties of Velasco
column2: we once again find ourselves at war with Mexico. The ceasefire is
column3: it seems
column4: now over. While many in our government never expected Mexico to live up to the terms of the treaties anyhow
column5: they do suggest that this might be enough cause for the Americans to intervene. Such an intervention would
column6: of course
column7: be inviting the wolves through the front door… but do we have any other choice?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC44846;A diplomat has arrived in Washington from Texas-- a part of the Mexican frontier
column2: settled by southerners who had been offered land by the Mexican government and who then rebelled against its tyranny. The diplomat has asked for American intervention in their war
column3: claiming that a treaty had been worked out with Mexico which they then of course immediately refuted. It seems like shaky grounds… but do we turn our backs on them?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC45102;Juan Pablo Duarte has founded a secret society called 'La Trinitaria'
column2: seeking complete independence of Santo Domingo from Haiti and other foreign powers. Many Caribenos are calling the man a visionary
column3: and his ideas are gaining great popularity in eastern Hispaniola.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46303;Porto Alegre is under Brazilian control once again. The gauchos
column2: however
column3: have promised to continue their rebellion against what they consider unfair rule from the throne. It may prove difficult in the coming years to keep the region calm.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Solano Lopez
column3: has turned his eye towards Brazilian lands to the southeast. Direct access to the Atlantic Ocean would be of great benefit to the country
column4: rather than relying on Uruguayan permission to use the river-- permission which might not always be forthcoming
column5: thanks to Brazilian interference. Perhaps it is time to flex Paraguay's muscle and establish an empire of our own?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the governor of Entre Rios
column3: has turned against the Rosas government and demanded that it submit to liberal demands for a new constitution. There are hints that neighboring governments might support Urquiza
column4: and that should he rise up in rebellion against us they will intervene on his behalf.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46611;With Rosas unable to defeat the Entre Rios rebellion
column2: he has been forced to flee Argentina and General Urquiza has assumed temporary control of the government. Meeting with liberals in Santa Fe
column3: they have drawn up a new constitution which has created an Argentine Republic. The Buenos Aires province is displeased and vows to resist
column4: but the wind of change is clear.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC46612;The rebellion in Entre Rios has been put down
column2: and both General Urquiza and his liberal supporters have been captured and executed. The Argentine states have submitted to the will of Buenos Aires.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49501;Members of the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government have approached us
column2: suggesting that the Kalmar Union must be ressurrected. For the moment
column3: this is simply an idea
column4: a suggestion that the Scandinavian nations should work together towards an eventual union. If we disagree
column5: it's possible that the idea dies here. If we don't
column6: $FROMCOUNTRY$ might be mortally insulted. If Scandinavians are to take their rightful place in Europe
column7: however
column8: perhaps there is merit in their proposal.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB49501;We see little reason to join such a union.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49502;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ proposal. It is now in our hands whether to let the Union die here and now
column2: or force $FROMCOUNTRY$  to join us whether they like it or not.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
I guess that's over then.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB49502;We'll see how they feel with an army in their capital...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49503;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has proposed the next logical step in our mutual cooperation: a customs union between $COUNTRY$ and $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: indeed all of Scandinavia
column3: which would remove the restrictions on trade between us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49504;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has suggested a political union between their country and $COUNTRY$
column2: arguing that this is the next logical step for Scandinavia's security.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA49504;It seems like a logical argument.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49505;Your Norwegian subjects seek to establish their own independent kingdom. The other European powers support their independence
column2: and will be upset if we refuse.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49506;This time they are not asking nicely. Independence or war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49507;Your Finnish subjects seek to form their own nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49508;Your Danish subjects wish to end our union.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC49509;As our power in Scandinavia wanes and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence grows
column2: so does the focus of the union move to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC49510;Our subjects in Finland have become restless
column2: and resistance against attempts of Russification have been growing. Many within the Russian government believe that a restoration of the Diet of Finland and limited self-government for their nation is the only answer.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC60140;With the new government firmly in control of our country
column2: they feel that now is the time for a constitutional convention. Everyone's views
column3: well at least everyone who truly matters
column4: will be represented in this new gathering to shape the path of our nation.;Alors que les libéraux tiennent les rênes de notre pays
column5: ils estiment le moment venu pour une convention constitutionnelle. Les vues de chacun
column6: du moins de tous ceux qui importent vraiment
column7: seront représentées dans cette nouvelle assemblée afin de forger la voie de nos nations.;Die Liberalen haben unser Land fest im Griff
column8: und sie glauben
column9: dass es jetzt an der Zeit für eine konstitutionelle Verfassung ist. In dieser neuen Verfassung
column10: die den zukünftigen Weg unserer Nation eben wird
column11: werden die Meinungen aller repräsentiert sein
column13: auf deren Meinung es wirklich ankommt.;;Los liberales
column14: con un firme control sobre el país
column15: creen que ha llegado el momento de organizar una convención constitucional. Todo el mundo (al menos todo el mundo que cuenta) estará representado en esta gran asamblea que dará forma al futuro de nuestro país.;;;;;;;;x  ;

column1: EVTDESC60160; Today crowds gathered in $CAPITAL$ to celebrate $COUNTRY$'s independence. In the modern world
column2: independence can be a fleeting thing-- so we must enjoy it while we can. Today
column3: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags wave from every window and corner
column4: and jubilant citizens sing the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ anthem. It is a heartfelt theme that speaks of better tomorrows.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: our Imperial representative from Peking and effectively the governor of $COUNTRY$
column3: has informed our government that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has concluded a treaty with Russia-- a treaty that includes portions of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory
column4: with now must be handed over without comment. Should we refuse
column5: we face war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ and Russia both.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80110;A diplomat from Russia has arrived in $COUNTRY$ with an infuriating demand: they wish to readjust the borders on our northeastern frontier
column2: agreed upon almost two hundred years ago. They wish access to a southern port upon the Sea of Japan
column3: meaning all of Haishenwai would be turned over to them. Any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-claimed territory would be handed over by us and our vassals. This is surely a wicked threat
column4: capitalizing on our current perceived weakness.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80111;Now that the rebellion in distant Xinjiang is finished
column2: there appears to be some question as to who has ownership over the Dungan basin. The western half of the basin
column3: in Qaratal
column4: is occupied by the wicked Russians… but they wish control over the eastern half in Ili
column5: as well. Should we surrender the basin peacefully
column6: or fight for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ honor?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80115;$COUNTRY$ is a nation hovering between two powers that could crush us without thought. A Russian diplomat has arrived in $CAPITAL$
column2: offering us protection in return for our fealty. Considering the alternative is possible invasion by the Chinese
column3: some think we should consider it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Hui Muslims in $PROVINCENAME$ are resentful of discrimination by the Qing government. Unrest in the province has stirred up anti-Manchu sentiment
column3: even among non-Muslims. The violence is threatening to spread throughout all of $STATENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1:
EVTDESC80121;Have Peace with Han Chinese!
Down with Qing court!

A rebellion has erupted in the southern province of Yunnan
column2: led by a rebel named Du Wenxiu. The man's forces have already captured Dali and driven out the Qing governor
column3: forcing our government to deal with the matter directly.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80122;With Qing forces marching into Kunming
column2: the Panthay Rebellion is officially over. The rebels and their leaders have been routed
column3: and already measures are being taken to ensure there are no further disturbances.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80123;We have driven the hated Manchu from Yunnan. At last
column2: victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80125;With Muslim-led unrest existing throughout the province on Xinjiang
column2: a Tajik adeventurer by the name of Yaqub Beg has led rebels to seize the capital of Kashgar and has driven Qing governors away. The situation in the frontier appears to be out of hand
column3: with these Muslims having declared an independent state and full Jihad against the Emperor.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80126;With Qing forces marching into Kashgar
column2: the Dungan Revolt is officially over. The rebels and their leaders have been routed
column3: and already measures are being taken to ensure there are no further disturbances.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC80127;We have driven the hated Manchu from Kashgaria. At last
column2: victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85000;There has been increasing violence against French missionaries in Korea
column2: recently culminating in the execution of Bishop Siméon-François Berneux-- head of the fledgling Korean Catholic Church-- and the subsequent killing of almost all priests in the country as well as thousands of Catholic Koreans. One surviving priest fled to the Qing Empire
column3: relaying his tale to a French war vessal which then launched a punitive expedition with the support of the French consul in Beijing. There is a call for France to go to war against Korea-- but this is complicated by the fact that Korea is a tributary state of the Qing. If we press the matter
column4: we risk war with the Koreans' master
column5: but if we back down it will be a great blow to our prestige.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85001;The foolish Koreans have begun executing Catholics within their territory
column2: and this has included a number of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ missionaries-- and now the French have demanded retribution. The problem
column3: naturally
column4: is that Korea is a Qing tributary. We are obligated to come to the Korean's defense
column5: even if this means war with $FROMCOUNTRY$. Of course
column6: there are those who say the Koreans have brought this on themselves. We would lose little sleep if we left them to their own devices
column7: and earn favor with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85002;One of our rulers has executed a group of French missionaries
column2: resulting in French outrage and a punitive expedition against $COUNTRY$-- which should have brought our Qing allies to our defense. Frustratingly
column3: and perhaps not unexpectedly
column4: the Qing have responded by severing their ties to $COUNTRY$ and abandoning us to our fate. War with the French seems likely.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to abandon Korea to its fate in order to curry favor with us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85004;One of our rulers has executed a group of French missionaries
column2: resulting in French outrage and a punitive expedition against $COUNTRY$-- which has brought our Qing allies to bear. Instead of abandoning us
column3: they have threatened war with the French should they intrude on our sovereignty. This may mean war with the French
column4: but at least we know our allies remain strong.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85005;Negotiations with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have not gone well. They are determined to protect their Korean vassals
column2: even if it means war with France.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
surveying the Korean coastline and damaged by a storm
column3: was drawing near Ganghwa Island in search of safe harbour when it was fired on by the coastal Korean fortress. In a fury
column4: our ship returned fire and then landed a party to battle the Koreans on land. After victory
column5: they returned home-- but word of the assault has spread. This is yet another example of Korea flaunting its disrect for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authority. Many within the government are suggesting we demand not only an apology
column6: but force a treaty upon the Koreans which will see their nation forced to open itself to our influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: surveying the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coastline and damaged by a storm
column3: was drawing near Ganghwa Island in search of safe harbour when it was fired on by the coastal fortress-- who assumed the vessel to be an enemy. In a fury
column4: their ship returned fire and then landed a party to battle our forces on land. They returned home victorious
column5: but words of the assault has spread and now a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ delegation has arrived in $CAPITAL$ to demand compensation-- in the form of an unequal treaty requiring $COUNTRY$ be opened to their influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: surveying the Korean coastline and damaged by a storm
column3: was drawing near Ganghwa Island in search of safe harbour when it was fired on by the coastal fortress-- who assumed the vessel to be an enemy. In a fury
column4: the Japanese ship returned fire and then landed a party to battle Korean forces on land. The Japanese returned home victorious
column5: but words of the assault has spread and now we hear tale that they have forced the Koreans to sign an unequal treaty in consequence... one which has forced them to sever tributary ties to $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85015;We are being overwhelmed by the superior might of Japanese armaments. Despite the loss of face
column2: we must consider offering the hated Japanese terms of our surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85020;With increasing frustration against government corruption and foreign influence in $COUNTRY$
column2: a rebel movement has appeared among followers of the Tonghak or 'Eastern Learning' ideology. They have been stirring up the peasant classes
column3: forming poorly-armed if numerous armies to purge the capital and rid the country of Japanese and other foreign presence. We will need to move quickly if we wish to prevent them from overthrowing the government or causing an incident with neighbouring powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85021;The unrest caused by the Tonghak movement appears to be coming to an end. The militant leaders have vanished into the countryside
column2: and their followers have dispersed. Order is restored-- for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85025;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has received reports of a massive rebellion forming in Korea
column2: serious enough that several members of the Korean government have sent an urgent call to $COUNTRY$ to intervene. Any forces we dispatch will likely provoke a response from Japan
column3: who will fear that we are attempting to uproot their influence. This may
column4: however
column5: be an opportunity for $COUNTRY$ to solidify our own influence in Korea-- many advisors are saying that we cannot allow the potential response from Japan stop us from acting.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85026;We have received reports that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has moved to intervene in the Tonghak Rebellion currently underway in Korea. It seems likely that
column2: should $FROMCOUNTRY$ succeed in quelling the rebellion
column3: they will become the unquestioned masters of Korea and all but eliminate what influence we possess there. The only sensible move is to send in forces to overthrow the Korean government and replace it with one that is more firmly pro-Japanese-- despite the conflict this will all but certainly spark with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85027;Reacting to reports that the Chinese are planning to intervene in the Tonghak Rebellion
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ forces today entered $CAPITAL$ and captured the Imperial Palace in a swift coup before our own armies could react. Pro-Japanese supporters have been installed in the new government
column3: effectively rendering us a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ vassal. Both rebels and loyalist forces throughout the country have reacted in rage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85028;Responding to news of our intended intervention
column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ forces today entered Seoul and captured the Korean Imperial Palace in a swift coup before our own armies could react. A pro-Japanese government has been installed
column3: effectively rendering Korea a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ vassal
column4: with orders to end any agreements and alliances with $COUNTRY$ and ban our forces from entering their nation. This is
column5: of course
column6: an insult of the highest magnitude.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Chinese have moved forces into Korea-- entering $CAPITAL$ and effectively setting up a government under their complete control in a swift coup. That there has been no reaction from the Japanese government is surprising
column3: just as it is frustrating that our embattled armies have had no chance to agree to this so-called 'help' from the Chinese. Either way
column4: rebels and loyalists alike are enraged at this foreign intrusion.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85030;The rebellion in Korea has grown worse
column2: and already we have reports of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ consulate under assault by rebel forces. It seems the Korean government is helpless. Considering that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ stands by doing nothing
column3: refusing Korean appeals for help
column4: it seems we are in a position to act-- some are suggesting that we engineer a pro-Japanese coup in Seoul to install a government more firmly in our control
column5: and prevent any possibility of an overthrow eliminating our influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90016;One of the most prominent members of Austrian aristocracy has been murdered by a Serbian assassin
column2: a member of a group of nationalists who seek to rejoin with the Serbian nation. There are definite suspicions that the Serbian government has been secretly helping these nationalists and is behind the event.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90017;With the recent unrest in Hungarian lands
column2: the local Hungarian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90018;With the recent unrest in Italian lands
column2: the local government of the Lombardy province has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90019;With the recent unrest in Croat lands
column2: the local Croatian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90020;With the recent unrest in Slovene lands
column2: the local Slovenian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90021;With the recent unrest in Czech lands
column2: the local Bohemian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90022;With the recent unrest in Slovak lands
column2: the local Slovakian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90025;It has become increasingly obvious that the Tunisian government operates independently from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. We cannot continue to control them directly
column2: and must either take measures to assert our dominance or allow them to seek their own path.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90029;With the recent unrest in Bulgarian lands
column2: the local Bulgarian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90030;With the recent unrest in Albanian lands
column2: the local Albanian government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90031;With the recent unrest in Bosniak lands
column2: the local Bosniak government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90032;With the recent unrest in Iraqi lands
column2: the local Iraqi government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90033;With the recent unrest in Crete
column2: the local government has demanded greater autonomy from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Failure to provide it will only lead to further ethnic unrest.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90034;The time has come to unite with our Greek brothers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90038;We have been approached by a Sardinian envoy
column2: the Count of Cavour
column3: who has made an interesting proposal: an alliance to make war against Austria
column4: gaining Sardinia the Austrian-held provinces of Lombardy. In exchange
column5: Sardinia would hand over Savoy and Nice to France. It is an interesting idea
column6: and one that allows France to take a role that would not paint us as the aggressors. Shall we agree?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90040;A mutiny by a group of sepoys in the service of the British East India company has ignited lingering resentment amongst our Indian subjects into open resistance against our rule. Should this grow out of hand
column2: all of our holdings in British India could be in jeopardy.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90041;Polish peasants in Austrian-held Galicia have risen up and slaughtered wealthy landowners
column2: leading to calls by nobility within the Free City of Krakow for a larger uprising. Many in Austria are seeing this as a reason to end Krakow's independence once and for all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90050;The duchies of Schleswig and Holstein have long been united and considered indivisible under the Danish crown
column2: but a question of royal claim to the duchies combined with the Holsteinian desire to join in the larger German Confederation to the south has led to considerable difficulty for King Frederick VII. The treatment of Danish people in Schleswig living under Holsteinian domination has led to a call for the duchy to be incorporated into $COUNTRY$ proper. This is unlikely to be looked on favorably by the conservative German aristocracy in Holstein.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90051;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ crown wishes to annex the Duchy of Schleswig
column2: which has long been considered indivisible from the Duchy of Holstein. The German aristocracy is enraged by this move. They believe their future lies with the German Confederation to the south
column3: but the Duke of Augustenberg has a stronger claim to Schleswig than the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ King. Schleswig-Holstein must forge its own path
column4: even if it means war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90052;Now that order has been restored to Schleswig-Holstein
column2: international pressure is mounting to uphold treaties regarding the region. Failure to restore nominal independence to the duchies and keep them united will result in tensions between $COUNTRY$ and other European powers
column3: and possibly war with the German Confederation to the south.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90053;King Frederick VII has died and left no heir. According to the recently-drafted constitution
column2: the crowns of both Denmark and Schleswig would pass to Duke Christian of Glücksburg. The crown of Holstein is more problematic
column3: however. The House of Augustenburg claims the crowns of both Schleswig and Holstein and is calling on German support. If the new consitution is signed
column4: Schleswig-Holstein will be officially divided. If it is not
column5: the Danish people will almost certainly rise up against their new king.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90054;The arrogant German aristocrats in Holstein have declared they intend to pursue a future with the German Confederation to the south
column2: and consider Schleswig an indivisible part of their territory. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ militants are angrily calling for the military to step in
column3: though some fear this may lead to war with the Germans.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90055;The question of Schleswig-Holstein's place within the German Confederation has now finally been resolved-- in our favor. This will have larger repercussions
column2: as the free German states will see that $COUNTRY$ is the true leader of the confederation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90056;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has brought Schleswig-Holstein under German control
column2: finally resolving its status within the confederation. This puts it in a unique position to assume leadership of the German Confederation as well as dominance over the North German states. We will need to take swift and decisive action if $COUNTRY$ is to maintain its position of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90057;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has brought Schleswig-Holstein under German control
column2: finally resolving its status within the confederation. It's possible that aligning ourselves with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is far more in our best interest
column3: as well as more likely to create a united Germany under North German dominance. We should reconsider our current allegiances.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90060;The Ottoman Empire has been in slow decline for much of the last century
column2: but never has this been more apparent than in recent years. The Empire's hold on the Balkans is weakening
column3: and this threatens to upset the entire balance of power in Eastern Europe as Russia and other countries will inevitably be drawn into the conflict. Many in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government feel that it falls on us to call the powers of Europe together and negotiate a settlement that will restore some semblance of stability to the area.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90061;Now that plans for the conference in $CAPITAL$ are underway
column2: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ statesmen are busy trying to determine what our stance on the issue should be. Some feel we should favor keeping the Ottoman Empire strong
column3: in the interest of preventing the Russians from expanding into the Middle East. This could potentially improve our relations with the Ottomans
column4: as well. Others believe stability in the Balkans should be the priority
column5: even though this might come at the expense of the Ottomans and our relationship with them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90062;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of $COUNTRY$ to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel this is a veiled attempt to carve up our nation
column2: and an insult
column3: but regardless we cannot let the congress go on without our attendance. We shall see what manner of 'negotiation' $FROMCOUNTRY$ intends.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90063;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of the Ottomans to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel this is a veiled attempt to bolster the shaky Empire's hold over the Middle East and balk Russian 'aggression'. Either way
column2: we cannot let the congress go on without our attendance. We shall see what manner of 'negotiation' $FROMCOUNTRY$ intends.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90064;We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ that they intend to hold a congress of European powers in their capital to discuss the ability of the Ottomans to maintain stability in the Balkans. Some feel we should favor keeping the Ottoman Empire strong
column2: in the interest of preventing the Russians from expanding into the Middle East. This could potentially improve our relations with the Ottomans
column3: as well. Others believe stability in the Balkans should be the priority
column4: even though this might come at the expense of the Ottomans and our relationship with them. Still others feel we should not take part in this veiled attempt at dismembering a sovereign nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90065;The Congress of $CAPITAL$: Keep the Empire Strong;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90065;The great powers of Europe joined together in $CAPITAL$ to negotiate the future of the Balkans. While there was much contention
column2: ultimately it was decided that the Ottoman Empire needed to be kept strong
column3: and any demands placed on it should not weaken its interests unduly. Few of the attendees were pleased
column4: the Russians in particular
column5: and even though the Congress favored the Ottomans it remains to be seen whether they will bow to European pressure and uphold the Congress's edict.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME90066;The Congress of $CAPITAL$: Stabilize the Balkans;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90066;The great powers of Europe joined together in $CAPITAL$ to negotiate the future of the Balkans
column2: with delegates from the Ottoman Empire also in attendance. While there was much contention
column3: ultimately it was decided that creating stability in the region was best even if it came at the expense of the Empire's power. The Russian delegates were pleased
column4: but Ottoman delegates left in a rage. It remains to be seen whether they will bow before the Congress's demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90067;Our delegates have returned from the Congress in $FROMCOUNTRY$ with mixed news: though the consensus reached was that $COUNTRY$ needed to be kept strong
column2: they still placed numerous demands upon us that would see the political map of the Balkans rearranged. If we choose to defy the European edict
column3: we could be facing wars from many fronts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90068;Our delegates have returned from the Congress in $FROMCOUNTRY$ with disheartening news: despite considerable dissension among those attending
column2: a consesus was reached that creating stability in the Balkans is more important that $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests and sovereignty. The demands are humiliating
column3: and will see us losing much of the Balkans if we agree. If we defy the Congress
column4: however
column5: we could be facing war from many fronts.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90071;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decreed that it will not abide by the demands of the Congress. The Treaty
column2: they say
column3: is so much worthless paper
column4: and they refuse to give up any of their sovereignty.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90075;Egypt has been effectively independent for some time. Now it has become all too apparent
column2: and a threat to the vision of the Ottoman Empire as master of the Orient... something which has been little more than an illusion
column3: but which the Ottomans must either address or have it shattered forever. War will come
column4: and Egypt will either be beaten back into place and made to heel at its master's side or seek its own destiny as a power in its own right. Only time will tell.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90077;While we expected immediate Ottoman reprisal
column2: it seems our former overlords are willing to negotiate. Their proposal is as follows: split the Levant between Egypt and the Ottoman Empire
column3: allow Ottoman influence to remain and they will permit our independence. Of course
column4: while this would retain an alliance with the Empire it seems like many to hardly be true independence at all. Still
column5: it would avoid a great deal of bloodshed.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90078;Our negotiations have been successful: Egypt has agreed to partition the Levant
column2: and we retain influence within their territory. While this spares us a great deal of bloodshed (and the possibility of an embarassing defeat)
column3: it does mean we have lost control over the Christian Holy Land in Palestine-- something that will not go over well with the powers of the world
column4: and with Russia in particular.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Egypt has refused to accept any Ottoman influence in their territory... and also refuses to give up control over any of the Levant. We have no choice but to take it from them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90080;The Turks have proven unable to retake the Levant from us
column2: despite all the assistance they have received from the rest of Europe. Even those great powers must now admit that the Levant rightfully belongs to us
column3: and that the 'Sick Man of Europe' has no claim over it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90081;We have brought Egypt to its knees and restored Ottoman rule to the area. Now we must decide whether to be gracious and allow them to retain autonomy
column2: while restricting their land and power
column3: or whether to rule all of Egypt directly and face the possibility of rebellions.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90082;An uprising in $PROVINCENAME$ has gained popularity throughout the region
column2: spreading the unrest throughout all of $STATENAME$. Local authorities have moved swiftly in an attempt to keep the violence contained.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90083;Still stinging from their defeat at the hands of the Ottomans
column2: the Egyptian aristocracy has focused the blame on the rapid westernization of the nation and the instability they claim it has brought. They are demanding that the government cling more strongly to tradition and repeal some of these reforms
column3: and there are fears that if they are not satisified they may instigate a revolt.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90084;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has declared that it will not accept Egyptian surrender
column2: and has rejected terms that the rest of Europe feels are quite fair-- instead pushing onwards to recapture all of Egypt. There are many within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government who feel this is a betrayal... $COUNTRY$ intervened to help maintain $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ from collapsing
column3: but perhaps they do not need our help at all?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90085;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have been watching the crisis develop in the Orient for some time
column2: and now that the Ottomans and Egyptians are at war it has become clear that the Empire's hold over its dominion is crumbling. Should the Egyptians successfully challenge Ottoman rule
column3: it could upset the entire balance of power in the region... something that many feel would threaten $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests. Still others believe that $COUNTRY$ must remain neutral
column4: despite the cost to our relations with the Empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90086;We have received word through the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ embassy pledging their support for the Ottoman Empire in our conflict with the Egyptians. This is heartening news.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90087;Our forces are on the run. It seems the hated Ottomans and their allies have won the day
column2: and we have little choice but to submit to their demands. We can try to hold out and turn the tide
column3: but it is far more likely that Egypt will simply be carved up into pieces by the imperialists if we do.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90088;The Egyptians have raised the white flag
column2: offering to abide by the Convention of London and return both Crete and the majority of the Levant to our control. Our advisors say that wresting control of the entire country is almost impossible
column3: and that we should take the offer while we can and let the Egyptians go.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90089;The Egyptians have surrendered to $FROMCOUNTRY$ and agreed to abide by the terms of the London Convention. Stability has been restored to the Orient... for now. All that remains is for us to decide whether to end hostilities with the Egyptians and return any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ lands that we hold.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90090;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have been watching the crisis develop in the Orient for some time
column2: and now that the Ottomans and Egyptians are at war it has become clear that the Empire's hold over its dominion is crumbling. Egyptian diplomats have contacted ours through channels
column3: and suggested that support in its war would be appreciated and rewarded. The Ottomans
column4: they rightfully point out
column5: are after all no friends of $COUNTRY$. Such an act could earn us the enmity of the Empire and its allies
column6: however
column7: and thus feel we must remain neutral in the conflict despite the possible benefit to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90091;We have received word that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have pledged their support for the Egyptians in their conflict with the Ottoman Empire. If something isn't done it could develop into an alliance between Egypt and $FROMCOUNTRY$ that could lead to their intervention in the war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC90092;We have received word that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have pledged their support for the Egyptians in their conflict with the Ottoman Empire. If we do not object now
column2: that support could lead to their intervention in the war. That objection
column3: however
column4: could also be seen as aggression on our part and harm our relations with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90093;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have sent a demand through diplomatic channels that we back down from our support of the Egyptians. Doing so will harm the influence we have gained in Egypt
column2: but if we do nothing we risk retaliation from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
settling matters with the Turks through a peace treaty which has seen the Levant taken from them and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in Egypt vastly reduced. We can let the matter lie
column3: or fight for both our stake in Egypt and our honor.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95095;The Norwegian government has formally requested to be granted full independence from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: a Cuban intellectual and radical who has spent a great deal of time organizing émigrés in the United States
column3: has returned to the colony and declared the Manifesto de Monticristi
column4: an exposition of the purposes and principles of the coming Cuban revolution. It seems the uprising has been in the planning for some time
column5: and if the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government intends to remain in control of Cuba it could have a battle ahead of it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90115;To hell with Spain! Remember the Maine!\n\nA riot by Cuban Spanish loyalists recently broke out in Havana
column2: leading to the destruction of the printing presses of four local newspapers which criticized the Spanish Army. The battleship USS Maine was sent to Havana in response to fears expressed by the American consulate that Americans in Cuba might be endangered. Not long after arriving
column3: the Maine was rocked by an explosion
column4: killing 268 of the crew and sinking the ship in the harbour. American newspapers have leapt on the event
column5: painting pictures of Spanish atrocities which have whipped up the public into a rage. People are calling for war against Spain and intervention in Cuba.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90120;Three Filipino priests have been executed in the Manila
column2: charged with subversion. While the executions are said to have been just
column3: they are now considered martyrs by the Filipino people and have inspired the creation of a literary and organization known as 'the Propaganda Movement'. The organization consists of Filipino émigrés in Spain
column4: primarily liberals and students
column5: who are attempting to increase awareness of the needs of the Philippines and foster better relations between Spain and its colony.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90125;We have received reports from colonial officers in Manila regarding rumors of a secret organization called the 'Katipunan'. Formed by anti-$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Filipinos
column2: they reportedly seek complete independence for the Philippines. It's possible that limited home rule might mollify some of these revolutionaries
column3: but nothing short of freedom will satisfy them for long. Tracking them down among sympathetic locals may prove difficult.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90130;With the recent unrest in Cuba
column2: the prospect of the Spanish government possibly selling the island to the United States has arisen. Should we attempt to pursue negotiations?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
conducted in secret
column3: the Spanish have finally refused to sell Cuba. More than one member of the government has been angered by this
column4: seeing the island as naturally falling into the American sphere of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90133;With no small amount of fanfare
column2: Spain has agreed to the sale of Cuba to the United States.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90135;With conditions in our Puerto Rican colony so poor
column2: the notion of independence has begun to spread among the local Caribenos. Reports from the colonial governor state a revolt has begun in the town of Lares
column3: one that may be difficult to put down.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90140;We have received reports of an independence movement having been formed in Puerto Rico
column2: with an uprising having been organized in the town of Yauco. While the movement doesn't yet have a great deal of support among local conservatives
column3: many of whom are hoping there is still a chance to achieve independence from $COUNTRY$ through peaceful means
column4: it's possible that their efforts could spread if we don't put a stop to it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90904;Perhaps $FROMCOUNTRY$ has grown beyond our ability to control them? They have been far more welcoming of western ways
column2: to the point that now they consider themselves 'civilized' and on par with the barbarians outside of $COUNTRY$... Indeed
column3: they even consider themselves above us
column4: and have thrown off $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule as if it were a bad shadow. They seek to chart an independent course
column5: but should we let them? Should we allow them to pretend they are not part of China
column6: and reject the heritage of thousand thousand years?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95026;The Liberian colony was founded as a homeland for freed American slaves by the American Colonization Society. Now that Liberia is considered a financial drain on its resources
column2: the ACS is urging Liberia to proclaim idependence and find its own destiny.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95027;The Liberian colony was founded as a homeland for freed American slaves by the American Colonization Society. Now that Liberia is considered a financial drain on its resources
column2: the ACS has convinced Liberia to request its independence from the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95076;A spontaneous protest by young Poles against conscription into the Russian Army has quickly erupted into a widespread insurrection
column2: supported by high-ranking Polish and Lithuanian officers and politicians. The eyes of all of Europe are upon us
column3: and if we deal with the insurgents too harshly it may hurt our relations with European powers. If we do not
column4: however
column5: the uprising may spread even further.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95200;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Turkmen peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Turkmenian state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95201;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Kazakh peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Kazakh state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95205;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Uzbek peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a single Uzbek state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95206;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are clamoring for all Uzebeks to be united under our flag.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95210;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Tajik peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a Tajik state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95215;A wave of nascent nationalism has begun stirring among the Kyrgyz peoples under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership. While the notion of a modern Kyrgyz state is still a new concept
column2: the possibility exists for it to spread and even lead to full rebellion in time. We must watch this carefully.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95216;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are clamoring for all Kyrgyz to be united under our flag.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC95250;Brunei's control over the southern regions has only ever been nominal
column2: and the region has been self-governed under the Sultan of Sarawak. During a recent crisis
column3: an Englishman by the name of James Brooke provided the Sultan invaluable assistance in restoring order
column4: and has been bestowed with the title of governor. This 'White Rajah' is now effectively the ruler
column5: and is seeking alliance with Brunei. We must either recognize the independence of an area we only barely controlled
column6: or seek to assert our authority and perhaps anger the English in the process.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95251;The Dutch East India Company has been slowly spreading its influence within the East Indies
column2: and is urging our government to establish protectorates over the remaining sultanates on the islands. Indeed
column3: they have been stirring up trouble in the region. Many within our government feel that if the Netherlands is to remain a power to be reckoned with
column4: it must expand its colonial holdings.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95255;The call has been sent out for the peoples of the East Indies to unify under a common banner
column2: for protection against foreign imperialism and to usher in a new world power to make the Europeans tremble. The people are cheering in the streets of $CAPITAL$ at the welcome news. Will $COUNTRY$ do its part?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95260;With the end of the democratic government of the United States
column2: there is a growing feeling among many Americans that the principles upon which the country were founded no longer apply. Talk of secession is frequent
column3: if quiet
column4: and as unrest begins to grow it's become increasingly more possible that liberal-minded states will attempt to pull out of the Union. If they do, we must be ready.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95261;A group calling themselves the Sons of Liberty has secretly formed in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: advocating either the overthrow of the totalitarian American regime or the secession of $STATENAME$ from the Union. American law-enforcement is doing its best to hunt down these traitors.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
Americans have taken to the streets to celebrate their regained liberties. Flags of the Sons of Liberty are in evidence everywhere. Let us hope this new era holds
column3: and that the Union has not already been sundered beyond repair.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95265;'On this day in the year of our lord
column2: $YEAR$
column3: do we declare the Union to be defunct
column4: a relic of the past now only a shadow of its former greatness. We delegates hereby declare ourselves the inheritors of that once-great legacy
column5: and forever more shall we be known as the Free States of America.'/n/nWith those words
column6: delegates from several states in the north have gathered in Philadelphia and declared their secession from the Union. Whether we can move fast enough to ensure those states never act upon the declaration
column7: or whether others will heed the call of these so-called 'Free Staters' remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95266;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Free States of America.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95267;'Whereas once the dream of our rightful independence was crushed
column2: we stand here in the city of Richmond to declare that it has been reborn. No longer can the South remain under the heel of the North and call it freedom-- the Confederacy must rise again!'/n/nWith those words
column3: a large group of delegates gathered in Richmond have declared the Confederate States of America reborn. At least one state has agreed to secede
column4: and its possible that others will join them… now or very soon. If we are to stop this new rebellion
column5: we will need to act quickly.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95268;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Confederate States of America.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95269;'Whereas once our land was the frontier of America
column2: now it is the frontier of freedom. The Oregon Country is a land where men achieve their destiny through honest toil and while believing in the equality of men. Since the Union no longer believes in the same
column3: we hereby declare it dead.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathering in the city of Portland have declared the secession of Oregon from the Union. While other parts of the region may join them
column5: it's unknown whether everyone there feels the same. Clearly this rebellion must be stopped before it gains further traction.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95270;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Oregon Country.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95271;'We are the true heartland of America. We know things that Washington has forgotten: the value of honesty
column2: the need for virtue
column3: and the true meaning of freedom. What they have put aside
column4: we shall pick up and keep close to our hearts-- for now
column5: a new nation is born. A republic that will stand the test of time as the nation we step away from has not.'/n/nWith these words
column6: a group of delegates gathered in the city of Denver has declared the creation of the Colorado Republic. Whether more states will join their rebellion still remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95272;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Colorado Republic.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95273;'What the fools in Washington have forgotten is that we are not their subjects. We are their allies. If they abuse us
column2: we do not lie back and ask for forgiveness. We leave. That is what we do here today: we are forging a new alliance of equals
column3: brothers with a common heritage who will never forget the evils that lie in tyranny and corruption.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathering in the city of Chicago have declared the formation of a 'New American Alliance'. The state of Illinois has seceded from the Union to create it
column5: and it's entirely possible that others will join them if we do not act quickly.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95274;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the New American Alliance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
