column1: EVTDESC95275;'Ours is a nation born of resolution. The Washington government thought it could stretch its hand across the breadth of North America
column2: that all they touched would bow down and be forever grateful for their overlordship. We say it is not so
column3: and stand here today to proclaim that there is a better way.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathered in Rapid City have declared the formation of the 'Dakota Republic'. South Dakota has seceded from the Union
column5: and it's possible that others may soon join them. Do they not realize how short-lived their rebellion will surely be?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95276;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Dakota Republic.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95277;'We have been the subjects of despots in Mexico as well as cruel tyrants in Washington
column2: and we stand here before you today to declare that we will stand for neither. Ours is a unique heritage
column3: and we will move forward with the intention of celebrating it in the spirit of freedom and goodwill for all mankind.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathered in Phoenix have declared the formation of a 'Pueblo Republic'. Arizona and New Mexico have both seceded from the union to form it
column5: daring us to stop their rebellion-- if we can.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95278;'Our path lies in a different direction -- with our hearts
column2: our faith
column3: and our integrity. May God watch over us and keep us safe in this perilous world.'/n/nWith these words
column4: the leader of the Mormons has declared the formation of the independent nation of Deseret
column5: encompassing both Utah and Nevada. They stand ready to resist any attempt by us to retake them through force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95279;'Our joining of the Union was with the understanding that it meant something-- we were joining a cause for true freedom in a world full of totalitarianism
column2: a cause far greater than any we could hope to achieve on our own. We were mistaken
column3: and now we must march forward on our own terms. May God help us all.'/n/nWith these words
column4: the governor of California met with a large number of delegates in San Francisco and declared their state seceded from the Union-- to the widespread support of many Californians.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95280;'We are the Lone Star State. We fought against the Mexicans and succeeded
column2: and now we shall fight against the Yankees if they come. Let them come. Texas bows before no-one.'/n/nWith these words
column3: the governor of Texas stood before a group of gathered delegates and declared their state seceded from the Union. Already an army of supporters is gathering in Austin
column4: ready to fight against any reprisal from Washington.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the birthplace of this nation and the home of the Liberty Bell. Let the bell ring
column3: let it announce to the world that our beloved homeland has fallen from grace. It is up to the Sons of Liberty to rise in its place
column4: to fight for truth and freedom wherever its meaning has been lost. We will brook no tyrants in America.'/n/nWith these words
column5: a group of delegates from throughout New England have declared their states seceded from the Union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the furthest frontier of the United States. We are a sturdy people who will stand on our own when called to-- and that call goes out to you now. Alaska never sought its independence
column3: but it will stand for what's right. God help us all.'/n/nWith these words
column4: the governor of Alaska spoke to delegates gathered at Stika and announced that the state-- cut off from support by the rest of the nation-- was forced to stand on its own. Whether the state intends to one day rejoin the Union if that situation changes is currently unknown.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95283;'Once we were a nation of our own
column2: but we joined with the United States and have earned our place in the Union. We are a hard-working people who will do whatever must be done-- and now we must act. Hawaii never sought its independence
column3: but it will stand for what's right. God help us all.'/n/nWith these words
column4: the governor of Hawaii spoke to delegates gathered at Honolulu and announced that the state-- cut off from support by the rest of the nation-- was forced to stand on its own. Whether the state intends to one day rejoin the Union if that situation changes is currently unknown.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: some citizens have brought up the possibility of joining the Confederation of Canada. It is a land of freedom
column3: and together we will be more powerful than we are separately. Shall we approach their government?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95316;A delegate from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has quietly approached the Canadian government
column2: asking for the former American state to be admitted to Confederation. While this may seem like a good idea
column3: the Americans may see us as opportunists for accepting.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95500;The colonial powers of the world have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. The outcome has become known as the 'General Act of the $CAPITAL$ Conference'
column2: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column3: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95501;A conference has been held in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: attended by all colonial powers
column3: to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. A general agreement has been reached
column4: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column5: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95502;Word has reached $COUNTRY$ of a great meeting of colonial powers in Europe
column2: wherein it was decided that African nations would be divided up amongst them-- as if our people were little more than children's toys discarded and left waiting to be picked up. This has caused a great deal of concern among those of our people with the knowledge to understand what this means. For others it has brought little more than resentment
column3: as well as vows to fight for our independence when the day comes.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95503;'We have seen the outsiders. They come
column2: with guns and riches we have never seen before. What they also bring is death
column3: and we must always be wary what lies behind their smiles.'\n\n$COUNTRY$ stands on good terms with much of the western world
column4: but our leaders are all too aware how quickly that could change. The Europeans believe we are not civilized
column5: and the tone of our contact with them is slowly changing from friendly interest in trade to a strange paternalism coupled with cultural superiority. For now
column6: $COUNTRY$ survives... but we must watch for the moment when the civilized nations decide our enslavement is the only way we can be 'saved'.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95504;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ muslims are calling for the Jihad to continue: all Islamic states of the Sahel
column2: united under one flag!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95505;European presence in $COUNTRY$ is felt everywhere. Their traders come to $CAPITAL$ and dictate to our own merchants how trade will commence. They take what they want and pay what they wish. They tell our government what laws we may pass
column2: and even when they do not we must always consider how they will react to what we do. If $COUNTRY$ does not act now
column3: they will turn our nation into a colony under our very noses-- but perhaps that has already happened
column4: and we must resign ourselves to their protection.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95506;Our presence in $FROMCOUNTRY$ has reached the point where $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt in every level of their society. They are a protectorate in all but name
column2: and the time has come for us to determine whether that status should be made official. Shall we agree to make $FROMCOUNTRY$ a protectorate and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colony
column3: or support their independence as a friendly ally?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95507;A disturbing report has reached us of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nationals being expelled from $FROMCOUNTRY$. Indeed
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has systematically eliminated our influence-- meaning we are in a position where we must either accept the humiliation of being thrown out of an uncivilized country or step in and assert our authority. There are some who say this is a golden opportunity to establish a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ protectorate
column3: while others say $FROMCOUNTRY$ is simply not worth the trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95508;A $COUNTRY_ADJ$ shipping company has come into the ownership of the Red Sea port of Assab
column2: sold to them by a local Afar sultan. The port would make for an excellent coaling station
column3: and perhaps even provide a base for $COUNTRY$ to expand our influence in the area. Pushing for more direct control
column4: however
column5: could cause tensions with Assab's owner -- who might feel they have greater right to the port than the sultan.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95509;The Red Sea port of Assab has been sold to $FROMCOUNTRY$ by the local Afar sultan. They have begun to use the port as a coaling station
column2: and fears within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are that they will use this base to expand their influence within $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Ethiopians have taken advantage of the situation to regain control over the Eritrean coastlands. Though we may yet regain control over the Sudan
column3: we should consider whether the Eritreans must be punished for this trespass.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95639;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in $COUNTRY$ for many years now
column2: or perhaps we should say they are attempting to
column3: as they have encountered considerable resistance among the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people. Recently
column4: in the southern region of Cochinchina
column5: one of the local aristocrats took offense to the intrusion of several missionaries and executed them-- without our leave. Word of the deed has reached the attention of the French government
column6: meaning their eye will almost certainly turn to us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95610;Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are warning that the Russians will continue their southward expansion. If we do not press north from India
column2: we will soon find the Russians on our doorstep... And
column3: at that point
column4: it will be a quick step for them to invade the British Raj directly. Steps must be taken to set up puppet governments between us and them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95611;Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are warning that the British will continue their northward expansion. If we do not press south
column2: Russia will soon have its southern borders exposed to European invasion. It does us no good to allow the British complete hegemony over Central Asia. Something must be done!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95612;The Great Game between the British Empire and Russia has one pushing ever northward and the other pushing ever southward
column2: with $COUNTRY$ caught in-between. Recently
column3: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers got into a skirmish with one of our neighbours... and the resulting incident has brought the infernal gaze of one of these powers upon us
column4: perhaps meaning war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95613;Thanks to the Great Game and its maneuvering
column2: tensions with $FROMCOUNTRY$ have been rising. Recently
column3: an incident occurred near their border where several $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers were attacked by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers. There were several deaths
column4: and while the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is apologetic there are those within $COUNTRY$ who are calling for us to move in and assume control of their government.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95614;It seems that $FROMCOUNTRY$ is content to accept the incident was not our intent and turn its attentions elsewhere. For the moment
column2: $COUNTRY$ is safe.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95616;Unrest within $FROMCOUNTRY$ against $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule has reached a boiling point
column2: and it appears the only solution is to step in and rule them directly. Should we fail to do so
column3: we may find $FROMCOUNTRY$ soon taken from our control and turned into a target for a foreign power's expansion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95639;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in $COUNTRY$ for many years now
column2: or perhaps we should say they are attempting to
column3: as they have encountered considerable resistance among the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people. Recently
column4: in the southern region of Cochinchina
column5: one of the local aristocrats took offense to the intrusion of several missionaries and executed them-- without our leave. Word of the deed has reached the attention of the French government
column6: meaning their eye will almost certainly turn to us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95640;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in Asia for many years now
column2: but they have encountered considerable persecution at the hands of Asian authorities. In $FROMCOUNTRY$
column3: the execution of several missionaries in the Cochinchina region has prompted the society to ask the French government for diplomatic intervention. So far
column4: discussion has gone nowhere and the idea has now arisen that forming a protectorate in the area may be our only solution.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95641;First they send their 'missionaries' into our country
column2: flouting our laws and offending our people with their spouted nonsense. They turn our own citizens away from the righteous path
column3: and expect us to do nothing? $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have seized upon this excuse to demand all of Cochinchina in recompense.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95645;We have an issue before us. The Vietnamese rule over our kingdom
column2: and it seems certain that
column3: very soon
column4: either they or the Thai will demand we submit in full and are swallowed whole. The French stand on our borders
column5: eyeing Indochina with their own ambitions. Perhaps they will make kinder rulers? Rebellion seems almost certain to end with Cambodia being torn to pieces by both.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95646;King Norodom of Cambodia has sent our government a request: he asks that the French intervene in his nation
column2: demanding it be released from Vietnamese control and made our protectorate. This would suit our goals in Indochina
column3: though it risks war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95647;Cambodia has been under Vietnamese control since our war with Siam. Now it seems the Cambodia king has approached the French and asked for protection
column2: and the French have agreed to offer it. They are demanding control over Cambodia
column3: on threat of war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95650;Many in our government believe we should press our influence in Indochina
column2: expanding our colony there to include some of our less civilized neighbours. Perhaps the time is right for war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95652;French diplomats have arrived in $CAPITAL$ with a set of demands: namely that we should surrender control of all eastern territories not 'rightfully ours'. This includes all land claimed by Laotian
column2: Khmer and Vietnamese minorities. It is an outrageous demand
column3: of course. How dare the French claim to be 'protectors' of these people! Yet… do we dare risk war with the Europeans?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95655;We are in a difficult situation. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces cannot hold out against the French onslaught
column2: and they plague us at every opportunity. Perhaps we must face the realities of the situation
column3: and sit with the French at the negotiation table to give them what they want. If we fail to do so
column4: $COUNTRY$ is surely lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96090;With the loss of $COUNTRY$ in the recent war
column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy has received much of the blame-- there have already been several assassination attempts
column3: and calls within the government for the monarchy to step down. Sentiment in the public has turned to the notion of $COUNTRY$ becoming a democracy... though some fear this will plunge the nation into even further chaos.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96100;A wave of nationalism has begun to spread among the Mashriqi
column2: fueled by their resentment over $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. Our governors in the region are understandably nervous
column3: and report that we can expect major rebellions in the coming years unless we are very careful.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96101;We have been granted self-rule by our $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and many people in $CAPITAL$ are flying the revolt flag. They are demanding freedom from foreigner rule
column3: and we will have difficulty keeping them under control... provided that's what we wish to do
column4: of course.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96105;The general insurgency by $COUNTRY$'s Arab population has been brought to an end. For the moment
column2: peace has been restored and the momentum of the Arab resistance dissolved.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
scion of the House of Saud
column3: has returned from exile in Kuwait. Not only that
column4: the man has managed to forge an alliance with the southern Bedouin tribes and retaken Riyadh. We must deal with ibn Saud quickly
column5: lest he retake even more land and reverse our earlier victory over his house.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96115;We have always been torn between our loyalty to Egypt and to the Ottoman Empire. The time has come to decide between them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96120;The House of Saud will never unite Arabia so long as the Emirate of Ha'il stands on our northern border. We must marshal our force and bring them to their knees.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96121;The House of Rashid will never unite Arabia so long as the Emirate of Nejd stands on our southern border. We must marshal our force and bring them to their knees.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96165;The Italians have managed to unify at long last
column2: threatening $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests in the region. We will have to decide whether it is in our best interests to object or to make friends with the new rulers. What has been done cannot now be undone
column3: after all
column4: and a united Italy could be a formidable enemy or a powerful $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ally.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96170;$COUNTRY$ has become the center of Italian nationalism
column2: its people calling out for unification. Italian flags are flying in the streets of $CAPITAL$
column3: and we must decide if we wish to support this call and bring all of Italy peacefully under our banner. If we refuse
column4: our people will be upset... and it's unlikely the opportunity will arise again.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96215;Nationalists have succeedeed in taking over $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies in India. Our governors have been driven out and our territory lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97000;The Revolution of Maria de Fonte;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97000;A growing dissatisfaction with the ruling government among Portugal's poor has grown into rebellion
column2: spurred on by popular discontent with the prohibition against burials inside churches. The instigator of the initial riots is a woman by the name of Maria
column3: and her nickname has come to be used to represent the rebellion-- which has a large contingent of peasant women among its supporters -- and which has been co-opted by revolutionaries in emulation of the rebellions elsewhere in Europe.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97001;The Maria de Fonte rebellion has spread to $PROVINCENAME$
column2: with the lower classes rising up in opposition to the ruling government. Many are calling for the government's resignation
column3: and there are signs that Queen Maria II may engineer a coup to restore order.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97002;Portuguese forces have managed to restore order in the countryside
column2: and the peasantry have been brought back under control. The danger of a royal coup has ended.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97003;Spurred on by the spreading revolts in Portugal
column2: Queen Maria II has suspended the constitution and installed a reactionary government presided over by João Francisco de Saldanha Oliveira e Daun
column3: 1st Duke of Saldanha. This has served to spur on the country's liberals to outrage
column4: and begun talk of civil war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97006;Our forces are slowly pacifying the Angolan countryside. If we are fortunate
column2: we will one day be able to connect our African colonies.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97007;Our forces are slowly pacifying the Mozambiquan countryside. If we are fortunate
column2: we will one day be able to connect our African colonies.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97010;We have received an ultimatum from $FROMCOUNTRY$: surrender our colonies between Angola and Mozambique or suffer the consequences. The Portuguese people feel this is an incredible betrayal by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$. They have traditionally been our ally
column2: and now they are trying to bully our rightful colonial holdings out of us? It cannot be borne!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97011;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to our terms-- though they are unhappy about it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and all but dared $COUNTRY$ to take their colonies from them-- if we can.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97015;Upon returning to Lisbon from a brief trip abroad
column2: King Carlos I and the royal family had their carriage fired upon by republican activists as they passed through the Terreiro do Paço. Three of the bullets struck and killed the King
column3: while another fatally wounded the heir to the throne
column4: Luis Filipe. During the turmoil
column5: the police killed the assassins... but the King and the royal heir were not saved and were pronounced dead at the Naval Arsenal soon afterwards. Manuel
column6: the king's youngest son
column7: has been quickly acclaimed as the new King of Portugal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97020;With the monarchy already weakened by the death of King Carlos
column2: republican opponents have been able to gather considerable support in the capital. Members of the Carbonária
column3: republican youth
column4: and elements of the army have instigated a coup d'état in the palace. The young King Manuel and his family have reportedly escaped for exile to England
column5: and only days later a new Portuguese Republic has been declared in Lisbon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: South Peru and Bolivia represents a threat to our interests. If the confederation is given time to solidify
column3: they could easily become a new powerhouse in South America-- and one that is no friend to $COUNTRY$. Thankfully there are signs that the confederation is unstable: the Peruvians chafe at the Bolivian leadership
column4: and given enough incentive they might withdraw. If we act now
column5: we might be able to stir our people against them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97055;With the recent losses suffered by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces
column2: confidence in the confederation has eroded. If we attempt to keep it together
column3: we must do so by force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97060;Brazil has traditionally held the right to intervene in Uruguayan internal affairs as it sees fit
column2: but in recent months the conservative Blanco government has proven to be increasingly intransigent. The rebel leader of the liberal Colorados
column3: Venancio Flores
column4: has approached us with the offer of an alliance: place him in power and Brazil has a firm ally in Uruguay once again.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97061;After several recent political conflicts with Brazil
column2: they have sent an ultimatum: place the rebel leader of the Colorados in charge of the government or there will be war. There are many in the government who feel that Brazil cannot be serious. Uruguay is no threat
column3: and they would risk angering the Platine nations with an invasion? This insulting ultimatum should be refused
column4: according to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97062;The Uruguayan government has rejected our demands. Perhaps they underestimate our willingness to see this matter to a swift end.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97065;We have no choice but to submit to the Brazilian demands. The Colorados are victorious.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97066;The government of Uruguay has given in to our demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the president of the republic and considered by many to be its founder
column3: has responded to his falling popularity by engaging in voting irregularities and seeking to annul the 1835 constitution in order to remain in power. This new constitution
column4: nicknamed the 'Carta de la Esclavitud' (or the 'letter of slavery') would anger a great number of the country's liberal populace.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: called the father of Ecuadorian conservatism
column3: has risen to power during a time of crisis. To some
column4: he is exactly what the country needs to see it through these troubled times. To others he is a tyrant. In either case
column5: Moreno now rules Ecuador with an iron fist.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97076;The jungles of Tarauaca lie in the heart of the Amazon
column2: and rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$. Currently there are $COUNTRY_ADJ$ settlers eager for the opportunity to settle the region and have asked for the funds to assist them
column3: though advisors say this may cause problems with neighboring states who also claim the territory.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97080;Chilean forces have occupied more of the lands in the southern continent. The pacification of the local natives is ongoing.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97085;Argentinian forces have occupied more of the lands in the southern continent. The pacification of the local natives is ongoing.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97086;Through the judicious use of force
column2: confiscation of native lands and the introduction of roads and other vestiges of civilization
column3: conditions in $PROVINCENAME$ have greatly improved. The native patagonians are proving to be contentious
column4: but their numbers are far too few for us to worry about.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97090;Now that the lands of Araucania and Patagonia are fully settled
column2: the Argentinians have approached us to work out a border treaty. They intend to claim the lands east of the Andes and are willing to concede the lands east of the Andes to us. If we do not come to an agreement
column3: future conflict is almost guaranteed.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97100;A dispute between local $PROVINCECULTURE$ leaders and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials in $PROVINCENAME$ has exploded into a riot
column2: and the violence quickly spread throughout $STATENAME$. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ army is stamping out the rebellion as best it can
column3: but fears persist that this could develop into a much larger problem if it continues.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97105;A dispute between $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocrats and a foreign governor has exploded into a riots in $CAPITAL$. Many $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens wish to see $COUNTRY$ freed from the yoke of its oppressor
column2: and are ready to rise up and fight against the foreign armies that are sure to come. The idea that $COUNTRY$ may become a battleground pleases few

column1: EVTDESC97110;The people of India are diverse
column2: consisting of numerous cultures and languages throughout the sub-continent. Seldom has there been any serious credence given to the idea of a single union crossing all cultural boundaries
column3: save by force of arms. This has recently changed
column4: with Indian nationalists in $COUNTRY$ calling for a true union-- one powerful enough to resist all imperialist efforts to conquer it. Surprisingly
column5: their calls have received a great deal of attention.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97111;The people of India are diverse
column2: consisting of numerous cultures and languages throughout the sub-continent. Seldom has there been any serious credence given to the idea of a single union crossing all cultural boundaries
column3: save by force of arms. This has recently changed
column4: with nationalists in $FROMCOUNTRY$ calling for a true India-- one united and powerful enough to resist all imperialist efforts to conquer it. Surprisingly
column5: their calls have received a great deal of attention in $COUNTRY$ and this unified nationalism has been rapidly spreading.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97115;With the death of Ranjit Singh
column2: a vacany has been left in the leadership of the Sikh Empire which will not be easily filled. The Maharajah's heir died suspiciously within months
column3: as did the heir to follow
column4: all due to infighting among the princes and the Panjabi nobility struggling to maintain power. Many fear this weakness will surely bring the British down upon the nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97120;Our lands in the Indian Raj have been overrun
column2: our enemies among the Indians having successfully driven us off the subcontinent. We have been forced to consider whether we should retreat from India altogether. There are those in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government who say the time has come: clearly the Indians wish us gone. Others say we must not submit to what amounts to a temporary setback. The Indians can be forced to submit
column3: if we focus our efforts on the matter.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97121;The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to an abrupt end. With most of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ India either occupied or in disarray
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has decided to retreat from the subcontinent completely. Governors have been spotted fleeing
column3: leaving colonial mansions completely emptied. While this does leave the nation in a state of relative chaos
column4: a great $COUNTRY_ADJ$ victory has been achieved! India is at last freed!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97150;An alarming incident has occurred at the Talambó hacienda in Ica. According to reports
column2: a fight broke out between two Spanish nationals and a much larger group of locals. One of the Spaniards was killed. This would be nothing more than a local matter had the event not come to the attention of a Spanish admiral... who has subsequently demanded the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government issue a full apology to Spain. Considering it was not long ago that $COUNTRY$ fought for its independence from Spain
column3: submitting to such an indignity would go over less than well with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97151;News has arrived in $CAPITAL$ regarding an incident in $FROMCOUNTRY$. According to reports
column2: a fight broke out between two Spanish nationals and a much larger group of locals. One of the Spaniards was killed. This would be nothing more than a local matter had the event not come to the attention of a Spanish admiral... who subsequently demanded the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government issue a full apology to Spain. They have done so
column3: but some advisors bring up a possibility: if $FROMCOUNTRY$ is this fearful of Spanish power
column4: perhaps now is the time to reassert our authority over our lost Spanish colonies? Cutting $FROMCOUNTRY$ down to size may force them to submit to our rule as a vassal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97152;News has arrived in $CAPITAL$ regarding an incident in $FROMCOUNTRY$. According to reports
column2: a fight broke out between two Spanish nationals and a much larger group of locals. One of the Spaniards was killed. This would be nothing more than a local matter had the event not come to the attention of a Spanish admiral... who subsequently demanded the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government issue a full apology to Spain. Predictably
column3: they have refused. This is a direct challenge to Spanish authority from a former colony. If we do not react in kind
column4: we will lose a great deal of credibility. Perhaps now is the time to reassert our authority over $FROMCOUNTRY$? Cutting them down to size may force them to submit to our rule as a vassal.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97153;A Spanish deputy by the name of Eusebio de Salazar y Mazaredo has arrived to negotiate with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government regarding the Talambó incident. The problem
column2: however
column3: is that he carries with him the title of Royal Commissary. This is a title reserved for officials dealing with Spanish colonies
column4: not ambassadors to sovereign nations. This is a deliberate insult to $COUNTRY$!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97155;We have been overrun by Spain
column2: and now have no choice but to surrender our sovereignty to our former colonial overlords. It is a bitter day.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97156;An envoy from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has arrived with the expected news: they have agreed to submit themselves to Spanish rule once again
column2: if we so choose. Some might wonder if it's worthwhile for Spain to involve itself in South American affairs
column3: particularly since they will ultimately try to rebel out from under us. Perhaps we have proven our point?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97160;Spanish imperialism has raised its head once again
column2: with the Spanish throne having gone to war with a neighbour in an effort to restore their lost influence. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people are rightfully worried at what this means
column3: and there are calls for us to take a stand.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97161;An envoy from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has issued a protest to our involvement in South America
column2: telling us in no uncertain terms that we are not welcome.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97165;The United States claims it intends to protect the New World from encroachment from imperial powers in Europe. Now that Spain has made its imperialist intentions evident
column2: perhaps it is time we put the so-called Monroe Doctrine to the test?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97166;The Monroe Doctrine dictates that the United States is responsible for protecting the western hemisphere from encroachment from imperialists in Europe -- such as what Spain is doing right now in South America. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has put the Monroe Doctrine to the test and appealed to us for aid
column2: asking for an alliance in case Spain should decide to expand its influence even further.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97700;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: and have gained control of the capital. They send word they wish to bring all our lost provinces back to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control. Agreeing would mean risking war
column3: but refusing would mean angering our people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97175;The rebellion in $STATENAME$ has been going on for far too long
column2: and we are in danger of losing control of the colony entirely. Local militants in $PROVINCENAME$ have gone so far as to declare their nation's independence... and while that isn't yet true
column3: as $STATENAME$'s state of chaos is still far too widespread
column4: it's an embarassment to $COUNTRY$ and
column5: given enough time
column6: the militants might gain enough control to earn the colony's independence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97180;Rebels in a neighboring colony have destabilized it enough that the people there are calling out for $COUNTRY$ to restore order. This is our land
column2: and it seems that the western powers have all but abandoned it to chaos. So why shouldn't we intervene? Still
column3: there are some who say this will only damage our relationship with a power... one we cannot afford to anger.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97181;We have lost control of the situation in $STATENAME$. The rebels have gained sufficient control that they have ejected the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ governors and declared their independence... for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97500;Sovereign Authority in the Holy Land;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97500;The French ambassador has arrived with the following demand: they wish the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to recognize them as the sovereign authority over the Holy Land in Palestine
column2: turning control over all Christian sites to the French. The Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca signed with Russia in 1774 states that they are the sole protector of Eastern Christians
column3: and should we agree to the French demands it will almost surely lead to conflict with the Russians.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97501;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has refused our demand
column2: stating that the 1774 Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca grants Russia authority over Eastern Christians and not France. More than likely they simply fear what the Russians will do. A show of force combined with the enticement of a protective alliance might compel them
column3: though that will certainly cause friction with the Russians and there are some who say we should discontinue this venture now while we still have the chance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97502;The French are not willing to abandon their claims to the Holy Land. There have been several demonstrations of naval force along our coast
column2: and these have been combined with offers of protection against Russian retaliation. If we agree
column3: we have a friend in France but almost certainly war with the Russians. If we refuse
column4: very likely we will have a war with France on our hands. Which would we prefer?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97503;The French have successfully pressured $FROMCOUNTRY$ into accepting their claim of authority over Christian holy sites in Palestine
column2: authority which has traditionally belonged to us ever since the 1774 Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca. This is a breach of the treaty and a threat to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ interests in the Holy Land.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97504;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed that the French and the Roman Catholic Church should be the supreme Christian authority in the Holy Land
column2: and have turned over control of Christian holy places-- including the keys to the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem. This is in contravention to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ treaty with Russia
column3: and will no doubt lead to conflict
column4: but is at the same time a boon to our prestige.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME97505;French Authority in the Holy Land;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97505;Through a combination of military and political pressure
column2: we now have no choice but to accept French claims in the Holy Land.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97506;In what is perhaps a foolish move
column2: the French have pressure the Turks into accepting their sovereign authority over the Holy Land in Palestine... authority which has traditionally rested with the Russians since the Treaty of Küçük Kaynarca. The question simply remains whether we should interfere. While holy sites are not our concern
column3: trade routes through the Levant lead to India... and a Russian war with the Turks could directly threaten our interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and much of our nation is either overrun or in complete chaos. We cannot continue. Our only option may be to surrender to the Russians and negotiate a treaty
column3: in which we will doubtless be forced to hand over many concessions. Failure to do so
column4: or should the Russians refuse our offer
column5: could mean the war continuing for a very long time yet-- and $COUNTRY$'s utter ruin.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: begging for terms of surrender. It will mean relinquishing our current wargoals and sitting down with them to work out the terms of a treaty once the war is done
column3: but we are confident they will be to $COUNTRY$'s benefit. No doubt the other powers of Europe will be far less pleased
column4: but that is not our concern. Such a treaty will prevent this war from continuing on interminably.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the terms of Russia's treaty are punishing indeed.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97510;The powers of Europe have met in Paris to settle the recent matter of the Crimean War. One of the provisions set out is that the newly-united Romanians would receive the Budjak in southern Bessarabia (also known as Izmail). Refusing would put us at odds with the rest of Europe and perhaps lead to further war. Accepting might repair some of our relations with Romania
column2: but would definitely be a blow to our prestige and our interests in the region.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97515;To this day we remain a subject of the Turks. A growing movement has demanded our indpendence
column2: and there are those who believe an offer of alliance with the Russians along with a guarantee of returning their lands in southern Bessarabia might entice them to support our efforts. Still others fear what a war of independence with the Turks will do to our nation. Is it worth it?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97516;The Romanians have approached us with a deal: in exchange for our assistance in their war of independence against the Turks
column2: they will return our lands in southern Bessarabia. It is a way to regain our influence in the region
column3: though it does come with a steep price.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97517;We have received word from the Russian government: they have agreed to support our claim of independence in exchange for Izmail.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97518;We have received word from the Russian government: they have refused to support our claim of independence in exchange for Izmail. We are on our own.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97525;The cursed Romanians have coaxed the Russians into declaring war on us in support of their independence. We cannot let this stand!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97526;The Romanians have foolishly declared them independence. We must take action at once!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97550;The Federal Republic of Central America has been chaotic since its inception. Liberals who had high hopes for the union are in constant battle with conservatives
column2: in particular the clergy and wealthy landowners
column3: and there is a general fear of domination by Guatemala. At this point
column4: the struggle to maintain the union seems like an almost impossible one.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97551;With rebels in Nicaragua having already declared its independence from the Federal Republic
column2: it has become next to impossible for the government to maintain order in southern Costa Rica. Government authorities have withdrawn as locals have overtaken the capital in San Jose.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97552;With rebels in Honduras having already declared its independence from the Federal Republic
column2: it has become next to impossible for the government to maintain order in Nicaragua. Government authorities have withdrawn as locals have overtaken the capital in Managua.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC975521;With rebels rampant in the south
column2: it has become next to impossible for the government to maintain order in Honduras. Government authorities have withdrawn as locals have overtaken the capital in Comayagua.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97553;The government has managed to restore order in the El Salvador region. Officials in San Salvador have re-dedicated themselves to the future of the union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97554;The government has managed to restore order in the Honduras region. Officials in Comayagua have re-dedicated themselves to the future of the union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97555;The government has managed to restore order in the Nicaragua region. Officials in Managua have re-dedicated themselves to the future of the union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97556;The government has managed to restore order in the Costa Rica region. Officials in San Jose have re-dedicated themselves to the future of the union.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC97560;The Federal Republic of Central America is rapidly disintegrating. Members of the government have met in $CAPITAL$ to discuss whether the union should be officially dissolved and the state of Guatemala declared
column2: or whether we should fight to preserve what we have. Some consider that to be an impossible task
column3: though liberals argue that we should not allow conservatives doom the region to a future of division and internal squabbling.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97561;With our forces off valiantly facing the enemy
column2: rebels have taken advantage of the situation and stormed $CAPITAL$. They have taken over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government and already done a great deal of damage in order to drive out foreign influence in $COUNTRY$. Without the forces to oppose them
column3: there is little we can do.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97562;$CAPITAL$ has been taken by the enemy
column2: and a great deal of $COUNTRY$ is lost to our control. Many are saying that we only continue the war because our foreign masters insist that we do so
column3: and that the time has come for us to let go of these ties-- no matter the consequences. Perhaps they are right
column4: though it seems the situation is dire for $COUNTRY$'s future no matter what we do.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97566;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is besieged by rebels
column2: and threatens to fall if they do not receive assistance from $COUNTRY$. They warn us that if the rebels are successful
column3: it's very likely that $FROMCOUNTRY$ would cease to be in $COUNTRY$'s sphere of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: conflict with the native Xhosa has flared into violence in our Cape Colony. A band of Xhosa warriors spilled across the border
column3: stealing cattle and burning down a host of British farmsteads. Colonial citizens are demanding that the governor take action.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97571;We have received reports from the Cape Colony that there has been yet another outbreak of violence between the Xhosa natives and the colonials. This time it is evidently caused by natives returning from the diamond mines
column2: attempting to take back control of their lands without any consideration for due process. Many within the Cape Colony believe it is time that the military moved in and took over their lands completely.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
Sakoku was the foreign relations policy of Japan instituted by the Tokugawa shogunate in the 17th century
column3: with no foreigner allowed to enter the country on pain of death. While some contact with westerners was permitted in the south
column4: at the Dejima trade enclave in particular
column5: such contact was strictly regulated and kept Japan in a state of isolation from the rest of the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Rangaku referred to the body of knowledge developed by Japan through its contacts with the Dutch enclave at Dejima. Despite the enforced isolation of the nation
column3: this policy of learning allowed western influences to spread-- particularly in the southern domains of Satsuma and Choshu.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97606;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with a treaty in hand: we have gained numerous trade concessions
column2: but more importantly we have cracked open the shield that is Japan's policy of isolation. This is a great coup for American diplomacy and influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97607;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with unfortunate news: they have chosen to defy his ultimatum and thumb their collective noses at our government. Should we back down now
column2: it will be a great blow to our prestige and our influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97608;We are being overwhelmed by the superior might of western armaments. Despite the loss of face
column2: we must consider offering the hated foreigners terms of our surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97609;We have formally concluded a treaty with the Japanese which will see our influence restored
column2: and our demands for their ports to be opened to our ships to be met. Additionally
column3: an indemnity will be placed upon their government to make up for the expense of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ war effort.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97610;Despite the overwhelming odds against them
column2: the Japanese have refused our generous offer of surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97615;'Revere the emperor and expel the barbarians!'\n\nThis is the slogan chanted by neo-confucian activists
column2: reacting to the Tokugawa shogunate's opening of Japan to foreigners. There have been growing reports of violence all over the country
column3: primarily against foreign visitors and statesmen but also against the shogunate itself. Each incident chips away at Tokugawa control over the daimyo and erodes relations with the western powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97616;There has been an incident in $PROVINCENAME$ where samurai
column2: acting under the political slogan of 'Sonno Joi'
column3: have committed violence against foreigners conducting business in $STATENAME$. The incident has affected the Tokugawa shogunate's relations with foreign powers
column4: as well as incited locals into riot.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: is a challenge to the shogunate's power
column4: and may serve to further incite rebellion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: and is a challenge to the shogunate's power. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan must decide whether it supports the Emperor's edict or quietly opposes it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the 13th shogun of Japan
column3: has died childless. This has begun a struggle within the bakufu to select a replacement. The southern tozama daimyo wish to see Tokugawa Yoshinobu become shogun
column4: while the fudai daimyo and shogunate officials are more in favor of Tokugawa Iemochi-- even though he is still but a child. It seems certain that
column5: no matter which candidate is victorious
column6: the disaffected daimyo will see this as a loss of power and make trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97621;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Yoshinobu as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the tozama daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the tozama will be permitted more influence within the shogunate.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the relatives and close allies of the Tokugawa clan
column3: supported the appointment of young Iemochi as the new shogun following Iesada's death
column4: instead the leader of the bakufu will be Yoshinobu... a candidate favored by the outsider tozama daimyo. The fudai are growing increasingly alarmed at the insidious influence of the tozama
column5: and there is a stirring sentiment that perhaps the time has come for a grander change.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97623;Pandering once again to the fudai daimyo
column2: all relatives and close allies within the bakufu
column3: the child Iemochi has been appointed shogun-- instead of the more sensible candidate chosen by the tozama. It is becoming increasingly clear that a larger change is necessary. Perhaps the time has come for the Emperor to rule Japan
column4: a single leader to bring the nation into this new era?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97624;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Iemochi as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the fudai daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the outsider tozama will have their influence in the bakufu kept to a minimum.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97625;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point. Many are urging that a policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court-- may be required.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97626;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: and thus the bakufu has begun a compromise policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court. Some are seeing this as a sign of further weakness.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97627;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: yet the shogunate refuses to compromise with the imperial court. Many are certain this will only speed up the coming conflict.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97630;There are some who believe that Emperor Komei was assassinated-- delivered a handkerchief laced with smallpox
column2: perhaps by radicals who fear the possibility of compromise between the bakufu and the imperial court. No matter the truth
column3: the death of the Emperor has placed the young Emperor Meiji upon the imperial throne and eliminated any chance of compromise.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97636;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the outsider tozama
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. If so
column4: this compounds injury with insult.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97637;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the fudai daimyo
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. This is hardly unexpected
column4: though the tozama agree this makes it clear that the shogunate is not the future of Japan.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97640;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ must make a decision: do we throw in our support with the imperial court
column2: or do we uphold our duty and support the shogun?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97641;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have seized control of the palace at Kyoto and declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over Japan. Word has it they have recruited fellow daimyo to stand with them in this traitorous war. We must issue a call to our allies and move at once!\n\n§RNOTE: To win this war
column2: you must occupy Kyoto and the rebellion leader's capital. You must not allow Edo to become occupied
column3: and you cannot White Peace. If you White Peace

column1: EVTDESC97642;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. We have little choice
column2: as they have forced our hand. Either we rise up against the Shogun now
column3: or the Shogun will assume we are behind the rebellion even if we are not. The time has come to fight!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97645;The Edo palace has been occupied
column2: and our loyal daimyo are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Emperor his victory. There is a place for the Tokugawa within the new order.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97646;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan forces have marched triumphantly into Edo
column2: and the Tokugawa shogunate has agreed to a permanent peace. For the first time since before the Sengoku
column3: the Imperial Court now rules Japan once again. Victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97647;Emperor Meiji has been restored to rule over Japan. An imperial messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our willing allegiance to the Emperor.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97648;A New Capital in the East?;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97648;While Kyoto has long been the capital of Japan
column2: and home to the Imperial Court
column3: the city of Edo has become the de facto capital-- for centuries it has been the center of shogunate power
column4: as well as a cultural and administrative center. The Emperor will need to decide whether the court should move to Edo and create a new capital... or remain in Kyoto and revitalize it instead.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97650;The Imperial palace at Kyoto has been occupied
column2: and our daimyo allies are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Shogun his victory. If we are fortunate
column3: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan will not be wiped out by this unfortunate turn of events.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97651;Tokugawa clan forces have marched triumphantly into Kyoto
column2: and the traitor daimyos have agreed to a permanent peace. The Bakumatsu has ended with the shogunate in control once again-- victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97652;The Tokugawa shogunate has once again asserted control over Japan. A bakufu messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our submission to direct rule from Edo.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97605;More 'black ships' have appeared off our shores
column2: these ones commanded by an American named Commodore Matthew Perry. The ill-tempered westerner is demanding an end to the Japanese policy of Sokoku-- specifically trading rights in several ports
column3: extraterritoriality for American sailors and protection for their shipwrecks. At first he demanded to negotiate with the Emperor
column4: but that is impossible. Thus it falls to the Shogun to either agree to his demands
column5: risking the appearance of weakness
column6: or refuse and bring the wrath of the Americans upon us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97660;With the ascension of Emperor Taisho
column2: whose poor health has prompted a shift in political power from Japan's old guard to the Imperial Diet
column3: democratic parties are beginning to see their influence spread throughout the country. Though democratic tradition is not deeply rooted
column4: the idea of enfranchisement as a right of the individual Japanese citizen has become far more broadly accepted. Students
column5: university professors and journalists inspired by Western schools of thought have organized public demonstrations to demand new reforms.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97665;A growing dissatisfaction among the former samurai with the abolition of the han system and the resulting reduction in their personal prestige has crystallized in a rebellion. Led by one of the most prestigious samurai leaders of the former Satsuma Domain
column2: Saigo Takamori
column3: the rebellion has attracted a large number of followers and will be a severe challenge for the Japanese government to deal with.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97670;The islands of Sakhalin and the Kurils are a natural extension of our holdings on Hokkaido
column2: and we must seek to claim these places before the Russians do so first.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97673;$COUNTRY$ has followed a militaristic path until now
column2: determined to set ourselves against our neighbours in the interest of security-- while risking that security with dangerous wars. The new $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has determined that this must change. We must follow a path of progress
column3: and instead devote outselves to technology and westernization if we are to remain free and whole.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97674;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has followed a policy of progress and westernization until now
column2: hoping that advancing $COUNTRY$ to match the Western powers would keep us safe. We now see this is in error
column3: and that only by an aggressive expansion of our borders can we hope to maintain the security of $COUNTRY$ proper.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97675;The Chinese have fallen into warring factions
column2: all but crumbling their power and leaving us an advantage we would be fools not to exploit. The Line of Advantage policy dictates that we should strike
column3: and strike soon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the hated Japanese have decided to strike at us and take control of our government. They shall find us a difficult target!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97677;Our nation's policy of the Line of Advantage dictates that we must expand our borders if we are to maintain security. Naturally
column2: our most vulnerable point lies in neighbouring Korea. They must either be brought under our direct control or made into a vassal if $COUNTRY$ is to be kept safe. Already $COUNTRY_ADJ$ generals are clamoring for war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97678;The recent murder of Japanese sailors off the coast of Formosa has given rise to a question within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government: should we use this excuse to step in and wrest control of the southern island? The Line of Advantage is clear
column2: dictating that the land would be invaluable to our goals. But are we willing to risk such a war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97679;After the recent murders of a number of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ sailors off the coast of Formosa
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has delivered a demand: turn over the island
column3: for the sake of their security
column4: or it shall be war between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY$. We know this is just an excuse for their militarist expansion... but can we stand up against their might?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97700;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: and have gained control of the capital. They send word they wish to bring all our lost provinces back to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control. Agreeing would mean risking war
column3: but refusing would mean angering our people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98000;The Zulus have slaughtered a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regiment that entered their territory without our authority. While we had not been seeking a war with the Zulus
column2: now our hand is forced. We must either back down and apologize
column3: or see this through to the bitter end.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98001;The time has come to consider joining the South African union. ;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC98002;Our colonial governor in South Africa declared an annexation of the Transvaal via special warrant several years ago
column2: one that the Boers have stubbornly resisted. Both Transvaal and the Oranje Free State have considerable resources which would be of value to $COUNTRY$
column3: and we must consider the idea that keeping them out of the hands of competitors for African dominance is just as much reason to annex them as using those resources for our ourselves. The Boer resistance has proven embarrasing. If we do not answer this with force
column4: it will make the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ look weak to the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98003;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have gone to war with the Transvaal
column2: and many Boers are fearful that $COUNTRY$ will surely be next. They are crying out to our government to ally with the Transvaalis and stop the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ from taking away their lands and their rights.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98004;We control the entire Cape Colony. There is no question now as to who the masters are in South Africa: the Boers. The time has come for us to end the war and unite the Boers under a single flag.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC98005;We have been approached by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats desperate for help in their war. Though they are loathe to do so
column2: they are asking for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protection. If we provide it
column3: it does mean we establish an excellent claim over their territory.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: many of the Boers are eager to leave the Cape Colony behind and travel to either the Transvaal or the oranje Free State where they feel they will be free to pursue their own interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98007;There has been general discontent among the Hungarians
column2: and a group of young revolutionaries have appeared to demand a number of concessions including freedom of the press. Giving them even that will not satisfy them completely
column3: but it might give the government time to put down this rebellion before it begins.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98008;A group of Czech radical democrats attempted to overthrow the government in a coup. They were unsuccessful
column2: but their actions have inspired their countrymen to rise up in demand of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98100;The treatment of slaves in Cuba has become increasingly harsh after recent unrest
column2: culminating in the so-called 'Ladder Conspiracy' which relates to a method of torture involving tying a slave to a ladder and whipping them until they confess or die. Reformists in the colony have been calling for a change in Spanish policy and an end to the slave trade there. Failure to do so could result in more uprisings
column3: but bowing to such pressure could have serious repercussions back home.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98105;Cuban sugar mill owner Carlos Manuel de Céspedes has issued the 'Grito de Yara'
column2: the 'Cry of Yara'
column3: declaring Cuban independence from $COUNTRY$ and freedom for his slaves. The man has many followers
column4: and his call has spread rapidly throughout the colony.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98200;The Boers are descendants of Dutch settlers in the eastern Cape Colony
column2: and they have never sat well with British rule. More and more of them are leaving their farmsteads and moving to the east and the northeast
column3: encroaching on territory traditionally ruled by the Xhosa and the Basotho. Conflict with those native peoples appears to be inevitable
column4: as perhaps is conflict with the Boers themselves should we allow any lands they claim to remain independent. As far as the British government is concerned
column5: the Boers are British subjects... no matter where they go.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98205;The Boers are eager to get away from British rule
column2: slowly leaving the lands of the Cape Colony and heading both east and north into the African wilds. The ones heading east are encroaching on Zulu territory
column3: however
column4: and it seems there is no end to them. They possess firearms
column5: but we have the superior manpower... and all our chiefs agree on one thing: if we do not do something about the Boers now
column6: they will dominate our territory and turn the Zulu people into colonial subjects.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98206;The Boer encroachment into Zulu lands has provoked a reaction: the Battle of Blood River
column2: prompted by the massacre of Piet Retief and his fellow pioneers after they attempted to negotiate borders for the new Natal settlement. The Voortrekkers won a decisive victory at the battle
column3: and have now carved out a new colony-- with the only question remaining whether the British will recognize their independence or continue to treat them as subjects of the crown. Either way
column4: further conflict seems certain.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98207;The Boers which have trekked eastward into Zulu lands have reached a surprising settlement with the natives: they have staked out permanent borders for their new colony
column2: and done so in relative peace. The real question remains whether we will allow this new Natalia Republic to stand. The Boers are British subjects
column3: after all
column4: and their existence will no doubt draw more Boers to their side... perhaps providing a threat to our African ambitions.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98210;The Boers of Natalia are once again chafing under British rule
column2: resenting the idea that even though they left the Cape Colony they have not escaped the British crown. There have been several altercations with British military foces
column3: and the recommendation of the colonial government is that Natal be annexed before the situation grows worse. If we do not
column4: then we must allow the Boers to find their own way-- and suffer the loss to our prestige this would entail.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98211;After a series of altercations between British colonial forces and the Boer militia
column2: the British crown has decided to cut its losses and allow Natal its independence. Finally we will control our own destiny
column3: away from the British now and forever!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98212;After a series of altercations between British colonial forces and the Boer militia
column2: we have received a demand from the British government that Natalia be annexed into the Cape Colony. For all our struggles to leave the British behind
column3: they yet follow us and refuse to allow us independence! So now we are faced with a choice: submit and move on
column4: to find a place beyond their reach once more
column5: or defy them and risk war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98213;We have received word from the Natalian government defying our annexation. Now we must either go to war or stand down in humiliation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC98215;The Boers have been slowly trekking north from the Cape Colony into areas normally claimed by the Basotho. After a number of skirmishes with natives
column2: they have come to dominate the Orange River valley and established a new colony-- one that is still technically under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ jurisdiction.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME98216;The Boers Overtake the Orange Valley;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC98216;We have endured the presence of the Boers
column2: colonists who resent the British and who have been trekking north to avoid their rule
column3: for several decades now. We even thought it was possible to co-exist peacefully. After a number of skirmishes
column4: all ending with our defeat at the hands of their firearms
column5: they have taken over our land in the Orange Valley and declared it their own. This is an outrage... yet what can we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98220;The Boers have been slowly trekking north from the Cape Colony into areas normally claimed by the Ndebele. After a number of skirmishes with natives
column2: they have come to dominate the Transvaal and established a new colony-- one that is still technically under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ jurisdiction.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98221;We have endured the presence of the Boers
column2: colonists who resent the British and who have been trekking north to avoid their rule
column3: for several decades now. We even thought it was possible to co-exist peacefully. After a number of skirmishes
column4: all ending with our defeat at the hands of their firearms
column5: they have taken over our land in the Transvaal and declared it their own. This is an outrage... yet what can we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: many of the Boers are eager to leave $PROVINCENAME$ behind and travel to either the Transvaal or the Oranje Free State where they feel they will be free to pursue their own interests.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98230;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial authorities have met with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to determine the requirements for our independence. They wish to see $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in $COUNTRY$ remain strong
column2: and would see us abandon any laws allowing slavery or the 'unethical' treatment of foreigners working in our territory ('uitlanders'
column3: as they are called). While our independence is a foregone conclusion
column4: we must decide just how much we abide by their demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98235;Migrants have been moving in large numbers through our African colonies on their way to the newly incorporated town of 'Johannesburg'
column2: on the edge of the Witwatersrand mountains
column3: where a major gold rush is taking place. The massive influx of foreign residents to the area is causing trouble along our borders and friction between our governments.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98236;Gold has been discovered in the Kimberley province
column2: leading to claims from both the Transvaal and Oranje governments that the region rightfully belongs to them. Mediation by the colonial government has led to Kimberley being awarded to the griquas-- who have subsequently consented to annexation by $COUNTRY$. This has led to considerable bad blood between the Boer and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ governments.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98240;The time has come to consider joining the South African union. ;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC98241;We have been approached by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats desperate for help in their war. Though they are loathe to do so
column2: they are asking for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protection. If we provide it
column3: it does mean we establish an excellent claim over their territory.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98245;Our colonial governor in South Africa declared an annexation of the Transvaal via special warrant several years ago
column2: one that the Boers have stubbornly resisted. Both Transvaal and the Oranje Free State have considerable resources which would be of value to $COUNTRY$
column3: and we must consider the idea that keeping them out of the hands of competitors for African dominance is just as much reason to annex them as using those resources for our ourselves. The Boer resistance has proven embarrasing. If we do not answer this with force
column4: it will make the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ look weak to the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98246;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have gone to war with the Transvaal
column2: and many Boers are fearful that $COUNTRY$ will surely be next. They are crying out to our government to ally with the Transvaalis and stop the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ from taking away their lands and their rights.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98247;The Boers have proven far more resilient than we ever would have thought possible
column2: and now we face the humiliating prospect of surrendering the Cape Colony to them. It seems we have little choice
column3: with the war going so badly and Cape Town already occupied. All we can do is decide whether we will pursue a conciliatory path with the Boers and perhaps make them future allies or aim at returning in the future and reclaiming what has been lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98248;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent negotiators to work out the terms of their surrender. The tone is one of reconciliation
column2: and it is clear the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ wishes to build good relations with us after the business of this war is done.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98249;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent negotiators to work out the terms of their surrender. The tone of the talks has been very bitter
column2: and it's clear the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government will do all it can to return and trouble us again in the future.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98250;The Zulus have slaughtered a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regiment that entered their territory without our authority. While we had not been seeking a war with the Zulus
column2: now our hand is forced. We must either back down and apologize
column3: or see this through to the bitter end.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: conflict with the native Xhosa has flared into violence in our Cape Colony. A band of Xhosa warriors spilled across the border
column3: stealing cattle and burning down a host of British farmsteads. Colonial citizens are demanding that the governor take action.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98256;We have received reports from the Cape Colony that there has been yet another outbreak of violence between the Xhosa natives and the colonials. This time it is evidently caused by natives returning from the diamond mines
column2: attempting to take back control of their lands without any consideration for due process. Many within the Cape Colony believe it is time that the military moved in and took over their lands completely.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98260;Other European nations are eyeing the region of Namaqualand
column2: directly to the north of our holdings in the Cape Colony. To forestall their ambitions
column3: it has been recommended that we establish an enclave at Walvis Bay and incorporate it into our southern colony.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98261;Many British settlers are pushing north of the Cape Colony into areas only tenuously claimed by our government. We should consider increasing our presence in the region and establishing greater colonial government
column2: before another country comes and claims it instead.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the people are all too keenly aware that the nation exists in a state of war. Debates in $CAPITAL$ rage over the state of the war
column3: though the overwhelming feeling is that now more than ever citizens should be supporting the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. Still
column4: there are some who believe that now is the perfect time for change.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: there is a general sense that things are not going to proceed smoothly. A sense of change is in the air
column3: and while not everyone wants that change it seems there are many who have leapt upon the election as a chance to make it happen. A recent riot in $CAPITAL$ was only barely kept under control
column4: and debates elsewhere in $COUNTRY$ are threatening to erupt into further violence as neither side is willing to budge.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98302;$COUNTRY$ has its share of problems-- and as the current election gets underway
column2: there is a sense among many that the current government is to blame. Justified or not
column3: that anger has instilled a sense that a regime change may be in the offing. Those who previously had never considered voting for any other party than the one in power are now considering doing just that.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: it becomes clear it will be a contentious one. The issues are clear and the battle lines between parties drawn
column3: and there are those who believe that while violence may not be the result the toppling of the current $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime could be.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: supporters of the current regime have rallied in $CAPITAL$. They claim that stability is required to deal with the problems facing $COUNTRY$
